As the family has only seasonal income, she decided to start dairy farming and she has been seeking loans from local financial institutions. Neli’s attempts have been unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

Neli is requesting a 1,500 GEL loan to purchase a cow. Her loan has been approved under the framework a startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This program enables the rural poor and inexperienced to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. Once she has purchased her cow, Neli will start producing dairy products such as cheese and yogurt to sell. Her new business initiative will give her the chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es: Diana, a sus 34 años de edad, es casada y aún no tiene hijos. Hace varios años aprendió todo lo relacionado con la confección, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus familiares y cuenta con una experiencia de más de 3 años en este sector pues ha laborado como operaria en diferentes talleres, donde ha ido ampliando sus conocimientos y ha perfeccionado su técnica. Actualmente desea retomar la confección de  acolchados, pues ya cuenta con clientela para estos productos, ya que hace algún tiempo los había hecho y se los están solicitando nuevamente. La cliente es una mujer emprendedora, activa, pujante y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante; por eso se motiva a solicitar el crédito que desea invertir en la compra de una máquina fileteadora con la cual podrá mejorar y agilizar su producción, lo que le permitirá entregar un producto bien terminado y de buena calidad, creando la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe, con los cuales podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y fortalecerlo para que sea rentable, reconocido y perdurable en el tiempo. Diana es consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar arduamente; sólo así podrá garantizar una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de mejor nivel de vida y bienestar, en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en:
Diana, 34, is married and does not yet have children.  Several years ago she learned everything related to dressmaking, thanks to the teachings of her family.  She has more than three years of experience in this field because she has worked in different workshops where she has been expanding her knowledge and perfecting her technique.  Now she wishes to resume making quilts because she already has customers for these products since she made them some time ago and the customers are requesting them again.

Diana is an enterprising, active, and strong woman who is eager to get ahead in life.  This is why she is motivated to ask for a loan that she wants to invest in the purchase of an overlock sewing machine with which she could improve and speed up her production.  This would allow her to deliver a completed and high quality product, creating the possibility of increasing her sales and the income that she receives, which she could continue investing in her business and strengthening it in order to be more profitable, well-known, and long-lasting.  Diana is aware that in order to achieve this she has to work hard; only this is able to guarantee favorable financial stability to enjoy a better living standard and well-being, in the company of her husband.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is 31 years old. He lives in the Kilifi area, which is north of Mombasa, Kenya. He does metal work as his business. He started the business from his own savings that he had earned. 

The major challenge that he faces is funding, and this makes it difficult for him to expand the business. He knew about Milango through friends, and now seeks a loan from Milango to buy a motorbike that will help him commute more easily to serve his customers. 

Nickson hopes that in five years he will be able to own a vehicle that will carry customers' goods to his place of work and forget about going to their homes. He will use the extra income that he will raise to open more branches of the business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, four of whom are in school, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop in the Philippines and also earns additional income by farming rice. Josephine is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to pay laborer's salaries and buy materials for her welding business.

Josephine has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries and buy materials for her welding shop

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is age 42, living with her spouse and 6 children.  Her whole family is living together and doing the same business. They have been making and selling hair wigs for many years. Nasreen and her daughters adhere the artificial hairs by hand. Her husband sells wigs in cosmetics shops in the market. 
She wants to grow her business and rapidly increase savings through profits but due to lack of funds she is unable to grow her business. 

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she could grow her business and savings as well.  Her dream is to rent a shop for her son’s business so that he can sell wigs by himself, and she wants to arrange the dowry for her daughter to use to marry. 

Nasreen says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: Nasreen is in the middle of the given picture.

loans.use: To buy ladies hair wigs to sell.

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en: Zohrab is from Dalarik village of Armavir region. His family consists of his elderly father, wife and four school age children (a daughter - 8 years old and three sons - 9, 13 and 15 years old).  Zohrab is working in the local self governance body, but the salary he receives there is not even close to covering the family's everyday costs. To take care of his large family, Zohrab breeds a livestock of cows, pigs, piglets, and cultivates alfalfa and grapes. He now wants to maintain and enlarge his livestock a little bit. To meet his goal, Zohrab plans to buy a cow, five steers and some forage for them. In order to do so, there is a need for a loan of USD 3,000, which he hopes to collect with the support of the lenders. Zohrab and his family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good wish to assist them in meeting their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a cow, five steers and forage for them

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs for her business raising pigs.

Beatriz has been in this business for 10 years. Beatriz earns more income from mat weaving.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 56 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional cows to raise.

Adela has been raising cows for seven years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows to raise

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace más de 25 años, sus cultivos son muy demandados en la zona, gracias a esto obtiene muy  buenas ganancias, es una persona con mucha educación, principios morales y respeto hacia las demás personas que lo rodean, es muy dedicado en sus labores lo que lo ha llevado a ser muy reconocido en la zona, de esta manera ha logrado  solventar algunos gastos familiares, Don Carlos solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. para continuar con la siembra y así incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Don Carlos, 65 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and children.  He has worked in farming corn and beans for more than 25 years.  His crops are in demand in the region.  Thanks to this he has very good earnings.  He is a person with a good education, morals and respect towards the people around him. He is very dedicated to his work, which has led him to be very well known in the region.  In this manner he has been able to pay the home's expenses.  

Don Carlos requests a loan to buy seeds, pest control, herbicides, fertilizers, etc. to continue farming and in this way increase his income and give his family the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pest control, herbicides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
This is Benilda. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy all the needed products. She has this business for seven years, and she also has an electronic loading (cell phone minutes) for additional income.

Her income from the loan was a big help in her family's everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy calamansi (Panama orange) scent, other ingredients, and bottles needed for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benilda dreams that her business will continue to flourish, and hopes to give a bright future to her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for calamansi (Panama orange) scent, other ingredients, and bottles needed for her business.

loans.name: Tsisia

texts.en:
This is Tsisia, age 29, from the small town of Khashuri. Thisia is married and lives with her husband and two children (2 and 10 years old). Thisia’s spouse is a distributor, working for a private company in return for a small monthly wage. 

Tsisia’s economic activity is the clothing trade business. She buys fashionable apparel for children, women, and men in the capital city open market, and sells the items in her community from her house.

She has been in this business for nearly two years, and it is going well. That is why Tsisia decided to develop the business and start a clothing store. She’s already hired the commercial space, and needs working capital to purchase a stock of merchandise.

With the received loan, she will buy apparel,and after the store is well-stocked, Tsisia will be able to attract many customers.

She will increase the inventory gradually and invest the profit in the same business.

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase stock of merchandise to start up a clothing store

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly, de 40 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, está casada con Roger quien es empleado público. Tiene su casa propia y habita cómodamente junto a sus 03 hijos de 19, 13  y 03 años. Merly se dedica a la venta de comidas tales como salchipapas, pollo frito, tallarín con pollo, etc. Se levanta temprano para ir al mercado a comprar todos los productos necesarios de la región y así poder empezar a preparar los deliciosos potajes que le coronan en su cuadra como la mejor cocinera por su buena sazón, vende su comida en la vereda de su casa, en donde acondicionó un lugar para que pueda realizar sus ventas. Lleva ya trabajando por más de 08  años en este negocio. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede distraerse al mismo tiempo que generar sus ingresos, le está yendo bien en su trabajo ya que recibe buenos ingresos diarios. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva, está muy contenta por que le brindaran un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos tales como arroz, papa, azúcar, entre otros para continuar con su trabajo, además de algunos utensilios que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Merly, age 40, is a cheerful and enterprising woman.  She is married to Roger, who is a public employee.  Merly has her own home and lives there comfortably with her three children (ages 19, 13, and 3).  She earns her living by selling food such as “salchipapas” (sausages and potatoes), fried chicken, pasta with chicken, and other dishes.  Merly leaves early for the market so that she can buy all the necessary regional ingredients for preparing delicious dishes.  Within her block, she has been crowned the best cook because of the good flavor of her food.  Merly sells from the sidewalk near her house since it is a suitable place for conducting her sales.  She has worked in this business for more than eight hears.  Merly enjoys her job because it provides her with a diversion and she can generate an income at the same time.  She is doing very well in her work and is able to generate a good daily income.  

This is her fourth Kiva loan.  Merly is very pleased to have financial backing so that she can increase her operating capital.  In addition, she promises to submit her loan payments in a punctual manner.  The amount of 1,500 PEN will be used to buy ingredients and supplies such as rice, potatoes, sugar, and other items for continuing her work.  In addition, she will acquire a few utensils that she needs to continue her job.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies such as rice, potatoes, sugar, utensils, and other items.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Doña Isabel de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su familia, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años donde comercializa todo tipo de productos como: granos básicos, sopas, refrescos, golosinas, especias, etc.  Es una persona trabajadora, responsable, y además muy puntual en sus pagos, la tienda está ubicada en una zona muy transitada lo que sirve como ventaja para poder obtener una mayor clientela, sus ingresos mensuales son muy buenos, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Isabel Solicita un crédito para comprar todo lo necesario para surtir mas sus tienda, como dulces, granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas etc. Para poder incrementar su nivel de ventas, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida económica.
texts.en: Doña Isabel is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has owned a store for the last several years where she sells all kinds of products such as grains, soups, soft drinks, candy, spices, etc. She is a hardworking, responsible person who is very punctual in making her payments. Her store is located in a very busy area, which is an advantage for her as it provides her with a larger clientele. Her monthly income is very good and thanks to her hard work she has been able to meet many of her household expenses. Doña Isabel is applying for a loan so that she can purchase everything she needs to supply her store, such as sweets, grains, candy, beverages, etc. In this way, she will be able to boost her sales, increase her income and improve the quality of her economic life.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, grains, candy, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es:
Orbelina de 51 años de edad, lamentablemente no tiene un nivel académico, vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos.
Los cuales tienen las edades de 22, 24, 13 y 17 años, los cuales dan gracias a Dios, el poder brindarles el estudio a sus hijos.

Se dedica a la elaboración de antojitos, como tamales, yuca frita, enchiladas, y pasteles etc. Ejerce su trabajo desde hace 9 años, lo aprendió por medio de una amiga quien gustosamente le enseño.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la compra de maíz, papas, aceite y los condimentos para la elaboración de los antojitos. Con los cuales mejorara las ventas y por consiguiente tendrá muchos mas clientes y satisfacer las necesidades básicas que en su hogar.  
La señora Orbelina tiene como objetivo, sacar adelante sus últimos 2 hijos, darles una educación, un nivel académico que les ayude  para la superación de los mismos y que en un futuro sean personas de provecho, para la humanidad. 

Además, anhela ver mejorada su vivienda, para obtener una seguridad, tanto para ella como para su familia. Espera alcanzar sus sueños con las ganancias  del trabajo arduo de todos los días; es decir, las ventas de sus antojitos.
texts.en:
Orbelina, 51, unfortunately does not have an academic education. She lives with her husband and four children, ages 13, 17, 22, and 24. They are thankful to God that they can give their children the chance to study. 

Orbelina makes antojitos (corn-based dishes) such as tamales, fried yuca, enchiladas, pastries, etc. She has been working for nine years. She learned about this business from a friend who was happy to teach her. She has applied for a loan to buy corn, potatoes, oil, and condiments to make her antojitos. With these ingredients, she will improve her sales, she will have more clients, and she will satisfy her household's basic needs.

Orbelina's goal is to provide for her two youngest children, giving them an education which will help them to succeed and to become people who benefit humanity in the future. She also hopes to make improvements to her home to have better security, for herself as well as for her family. She hopes to make her dreams come true with the earnings from her arduous daily work selling antojitos.

loans.use: to buy corn, potatoes, oil, and condiments to make antojitos.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Don Rogelio de 58 años de edad, viven casa propia junto a su familia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 40 años. Es una persona muy responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy amable con los demás lo que lo ha llevado a obtener una gran clientela establecida, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares. Don Rogelio solicita crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas,  etc. para poder incrementar  sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Rogelio, 58 years old, lives with his family in a home he owns. He has been growing corn for 40 years. He is a responsible, honest, hardworking person and is very friendly with others, which has helped him build a large customer network and enabled him to cover many of his household expenses. Rogelio is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, and so on so he can increase his earnings and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, and so on.

loans.name: Serafin

texts.es: Don Serafín de 65 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, desde hace mas de 25 años, él comercializa sus productos en el mercado, tiene una gran clientela que demanda sus productos, es una persona muy amable, responsable y dedicado sus labores, Don Serafín solicita un crédito para la compra de sulfato e insecticidas agrícolas para sus cultivos y de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Serafín is 65 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their three children. He has been growing corn for more than 25 years and sells his products in the market. He has a large customer base that buys his products. He is a very friendly, responsible, hardworking person. Serafín is requesting this loan to buy sulfate and agricultural pesticides for his crops so he can increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sulfate and agricultural pesticides.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta   de  comida el cual es muy conocido en su colonia. 
Doña Martha necesita el préstamo para la compra de carnes, condimentos, papas, plátanos, cebollas, tomates, tortillas, chiles, arroz, frijoles, etc. para poder elaborar sus productos para la venta. 
Doña Martha espera gracias al préstamo poder contar con  la  materia  prima  necesaria  para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento que se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Doña Martha espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y se convierta en uno de los más reconocido de la colonia y de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijas continúe con los estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Martha is a very hardworking and responsible person.  She lives with her children and husband in a community in the southern region of Honduras.  Her business is in selling food, and is very well known in her community.  Martha needs a loan to buy meats, condiments, potatoes, bananas, onions, tomatoes tortillas, chilis, rice, beans, etc. to be able to make the products she sells.

Martha is hopeful that, thanks to this loan, she will be able to count on the raw materials necessary to continue with her business, and respond to the demand of her clients.  Through this she hopes that her sales will increase significantly, and that will be reflected in the quality of life of her family in her home.

Martha hopes that her business will continue growing and convert into one of the most well known in the community.  Through this she will be able to continue supporting her family, and her children will continue their studies so that they will have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy meats, condiments, potatoes, bananas, onions, tomatoes, tortillas, chilis, rice, beans, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive  en casa de una familiar junto a su hija de 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, productos de belleza por catalogo  y granos básicos desde hace mas de dos años, es una persona responsable, honrada, presenta un buen carácter, humilde y trabajadora, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, lociones, etc. todo por mayor para poder incrementar sus ingresos y ofrecerle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is a single mother who lives in a relative's home along with her two-year-old daughter. She has made a living selling clothes, beauty products from a catalog, and basic grains for more than two years. She is a responsible, honorable, humble and hardworking person with good character. Thanks to her work, she has managed to cover some of her household costs. 

She is applying for a loan to buy more wholesale products, such as perfumes, deodorants, creams, lotions, etc., in order to increase her earnings and offer her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants, creams, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, egg, milk, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, egg, milk, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nelson Raúl

texts.es: Nelson tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y aún no tiene hijos. Hace varios años se dedica a realizar labores agrícolas, pues posee cultivos de flores cuya producción es vendida en diferentes comercializadoras de la zona donde reside; de esta manera ha logrado generar los ingresos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Esta actividad la aprendió de su familia, quien se ha dedicado a la agricultura por tradición, ya que provienen del campo. El cliente es un hombre pujante, activo, entusiasta y tiene un espíritu emprendedor que lo lleva a buscar mejores oportunidades para seguir adelante. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos y fertilizantes) con los cuales podrá continuar cuidando sus cultivos y sacar una producción de mejor calidad, así podrá vender las flores a mejor precio y mejorar el margen de utilidad que tiene por las ventas. Es así como Nelson desea seguir luchando para fortalecer su negocio y cumplir el sueño de tener un cultivo más amplio, que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo en el sector y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 31 years old, married, and still has no children.  He has been farming for several years.  Nelson grows flowers that are sold to different vendors in the area where he lives.  This enables him to generate the necessary income to satisfy basic household needs.  He learned this trade from his family since farming has been their tradition, having grown up in the country.  

Nelson is an energetic, active, and enthusiastic man who possesses an enterprising spirit.  This has enabled him to find better opportunities so that he can move forward.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy farming supplies in bulk (compost and fertilizers), which he will use to care for his crops in order to achieve production that is of better quality.  As a result, he will be able to sell flowers at a better price and improve the profit margin from his sales.  

Nelson strives to strengthen his business so that he can fulfill his dream of expanding his crop.  This will allow him to create more job opportunities in this area and improve his family’s living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for growing flowers.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: Don José, tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, tiene 7 hijos y vive en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa junto a su esposa e hijos. Hace 5 años que José esta cultivando yuca para la venta. Este cultivo lo tiene en un terreno que alquila y la producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para la limpieza y compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el cultivo de yuca, con el propósito de poderle dar buen mantenimiento y sacar mejor cosecha.Su meta es poder comprar un terreno para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and seven children in a village of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  For the past five years, Jose has been growing yucca on a plot of land that he rents. He sells what he grows in the local market.

Jose is requesting this loan for 20,000 HNL to buy fertilizers and manure, and to pay for labor to prepare the land for planting yucca. He says that the loan will help him to maintain the crop well, so that he has a better harvest. Jose says that his goal is to buy his own land for his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure, and to pay for labor to prepare the land for planting yucca.

loans.name: Nora Belinda

texts.es: Doña Nora, tiene 49 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara con sus hijos y esposo. Ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa y variedades. Hace 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella consiguió un local en la comunidad cercana de donde vive y vende pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa interior, faldas, zapatos,juguetes y otros. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo que es por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa nueva y variedades. Espera incrementar los ingresos para su familia y aumentar su clientela. Su sueño es crecer como microempresaria y generar ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia.
texts.en: Nora is 49 years old. She is married and has two children, and she lives in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara with her children and husband. She has her own business selling clothing and other goods. She has been working in this business for nine years. She obtained a retail space in a nearby village and sells pants, shirts, blouses, lingerie, skirts, shoes, toys, and other products. She is requesting a second loan of 12,000 lempiras to buy new clothing and other merchandise. She hopes to increase her family’s income and expand her customer base. Her dream is to grow as a businesswoman and increase her earnings so she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as pants, shirts, blouses, and other products to stock her business.

loans.name: Quintina

texts.es:
Quintina es separada, tiene cuatro hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel secundario. Se dedida a la elaboracion y comercializacion del comida (sajta, biste , pollo dorado y otros platillos bolivianos) tiene su puesto de venta en  un mercado.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de viveres (fideo , arroz, aceite y otros) ademas cuenta con papa en cantidad el credito requiere para( aumento de capital ).
El sueño de Quintina  es tener un restaurant en la localidad
texts.en:
Quintina is separated from her spouse and has four children.  She lives at her parents’ house in the city of La Paz.  

Quintina only has a secondary level education.  She prepares and sells food (spicy chicken, beefsteak, pan fried chicken, and other Bolivian dishes) from a vending stall at the market.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients (noodles, rice, oil, and other items).  In addition, she says that she produces potatoes in quantity, so the loan will help to increase her capital.  

Quintina dreams of owning a restaurant in town.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Las Dalias(Flat) Group

texts.es:
Las Dalias es un grupo integrado por 6 personas alegres y emprendedoras, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con el único objetivo de brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de Tierra Blanca donde las principales actividades económicas son el comercio y la ganadería. 

Dominga es uno de los integrantes del grupo, ella tiene la edad de 44 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor eduardo que trabaja como albañil. 

Ella platica que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar y cuando se caso decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de antojitos mexicanos y cosméticos  para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles estudios con su trabajo y esfuerzo lo logro pero sigue trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Ella realiza sus  ventas de cosméticos y antojitos casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos , como ya tiene tiempo realizando estas ventas es muy conocida y tiene buenos clientes. 

Ella piensa que lo que hace diferente su negocio de otros es la amabilidad y las ganas que les pone a sus ventas. 

un crédito de Vision fund le ayudara a comprar variedad de cosméticos(labiales, esmaltes, perfumes, cremas, delineadores, sombras, maquillajes) y insumos para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos.

Dominga desea que su negocio continué prosperando ya que le gustaría en un futuro poder abrir un pequeño Restaurante en la cual ofrecer a sus clientes sus ricos antojitos y comida corrida. 
 
los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Maria venta de jugos de piñas 
Rosa maria venta de cosmeticos
Laura taller mecanico 
Romarica reposteria 
Laura estetica
texts.en:
Las Dalias is a group made up of six happy and enterprising members. Every one of them has a business activity with the single goal of offering their families a better quality of life. This group is located in the municipality of Tierra Blanca, where the main industries are trade and livestock.

Dominga is one of the members of this group. She is 44 years old and only studied up to secondary school. She is married to Eduardo, who works as a bricklayer.

She says that from a very young age, her parents taught her to work. When she got married, she decided to start her own business selling Mexican antojitos (corn-based dishes) and cosmetics so that she could help her husband to provide for their children and give them an education. With her hard work and effort, she achieved this goal, but she continues working to improve her quality of life.

She sells cosmetics and antojitos door-to-door to neighbors and friends. Since she has been making sales for some time, she is very well-known and she has good clients. She thinks that what makes her business different from others is the friendly manner and energy that she puts into her sales.

This loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy a variety of cosmetics (lipstick, nail polish, perfumes, creams, eyeliner, eyeshadow, and make-up) and supplies to make Mexican antojitos.

Dominga hopes that her business continues to prosper, because in the future she would like to open a small restaurant where she can offer her delicious antojitos and fast food to her clients.

The other members of the group are:

Maria: Pineapple juice sales
Rosa: Cosmetics sales
Laura: Mechanic shop
Romarica: Confectionery
Laura: Beauty salon

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and ingredients to make Mexican antojitos.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 38 years old. She is a married woman and the mother of four children. In her family, there is a strict restriction over ladies to do any outside job. She wants to do a job at her home to grow the monthly income, but she is compelled not to due to her family members. 

Her husband has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, and it is the single source of income for her family, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, she has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and maintain some engine parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

She is hopeful that one day the mentality of her family will be changed, and she could do some job to grow the monthly income.

Rukhsana says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Julita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Julita is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es: María, a sus 57 años de edad se dedica a atender su negocio, un puesto de venta ambulante, donde ofrece confitería, mecato, cigarrillos, fritos, gaseosas, minutos y recargas a celular, actividad que realiza hace aproximadamente 15 años y, gracias al apoyo de la administración municipal ha realizado algunos cursos con los cuales ha aprendido a manejar su negocio, complementando con la experiencia que posee como comerciante independiente. De esta manera, con mucho esfuerzo, empeño, persistencia, constancia y dedicación ha logrado mantener en funcionamiento su establecimiento, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos, soportando las inclemencias del clima y los cambios urbanísticos por los que atraviesa la zona donde se encuentra ubicada. Con el ánimo de aumentar sus ventas, siempre está buscando opciones que le ayuden a mejorar la oferta de productos, para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de su cambiante clientela. Esto la lleva a solicitar su tercer ciclo de crédito, con el que desea surtir su negocio, comprando productos al por mayor (mecato, confitería, cigarrillos, refrescos, gaseosas, entre otros), así fortalecerá su negocio, tendrá mejores ingresos y podrá garantizar una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and has for 15 years sold foods and drinks - such as candies, snacks, cigarettes, chips, and sodas - from a cart. She also offers cell phone minutes and charging. 

With support from the city government, María has taken several courses in business management that have added to her experience as an independent entrepreneur. To this combination of experience and study, María has added the effort, tenacity, and dedication that have allowed her to sustain her business in the face of numerous challenges. Two of the greatest obstacles she faces are poor weather and changes in the neighborhoods where she works. 

María is always seeking new ways to increase the range of products that she can offer in order to meet the needs and tastes of her changing customer base. She is therefore applying for her third loan cycle and plans to use the loan funds to stock her business. María will purchase wholesale goods (snacks, candy, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other products), strengthening her business and boosting her income. She will then be able to ensure greater financial stability so that she and her husband can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business by purchasing wholesale goods (snacks, candy, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other products)

loans.name: G.s Doras Group

texts.es:
La señora  Dora  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposo y sus  3 hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería  desde hace más de 8 años. 
Doña Dora el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  abarrotería en  general como azúcar, frijoles, leche, café, pan, queso, arroz, agua, manteca, etc. Con el crédito espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan  a diario en esta  época de las fiestas patrias.
Doña Dora al igual que sus compañeras de grupo desean que su situación económica mejore con esta inversión que realicen en sus negocios y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad.
Doña Nely su negocio es  venta  de tortillas  y servicio de molino  desde hace 7 años 
Doña Senayda su negocio es la pulpería desde  hace 5 años.


Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto  del 2013
texts.en:
Dora is a very enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and three children in a community in the south of Honduras. Her business is a grocery store, which she has had for more than eight years.

Dora needs this loan to buy groceries, such as sugar, beans, milk, coffee, bread, cheese, rice, water, butter, etc. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales because she will have more fresh capital and products to offer her clients, who visit her daily during the season of national festivals.

Dora and her fellow group members hope that their financial circumstances improve with this investment in their businesses. In a few years, Dora hopes that her business will be well-positioned as the largest and most well-known store in the area. She also hopes that she will be able to continue supporting her children so that they become good people for society.

Nely has had a business selling tortillas and offering mill services for seven years.
Senayda has had a small grocery store for five years.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, milk, coffee, bread, cheese, rice, water, butter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alexander

texts.es: Luis tiene 22 años de edad, es Lic. de la carrera de Marketing y Publicidad, está desempleado, sus padres le apoyan para sus gastos de estudios de postgrado en Gerencia de Marketing y Ventas que cursa en la actualidad. Luis es un joven emprendedor con muchas ganas de superarse, solicita el apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso postgrado, lo cual es muy importante para su desarrollo profesional y personal.
texts.en:
Luis, age 22, is a marketing and publicity graduate.  He is unemployed.  His parents support him with his post graduate studies in retail management and marketing that he is currently taking.

Luis is an enterprising young man with a great desire to succeed.  He is requesting the help of a loan to pay for his post graduate studies.  This is very important for his professional and personal development.

loans.use: to pay for his post graduate studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a surrounding fence and a wooden roof in front of his house.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 27 años, está casada, además tiene un hijo de 3 años y actualmente se encuentra embarazada de sus futuros mellizos, vive junto a ellos en su casa propia. Sandra, tiene como actividad diaria la venta de productos comestibles en su tienda instalada en la parte frontal de su vivienda, atiende a sus clientes todos los días desde muy temprano, ofrece a la venta artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, leche, aceite, condimentos, accesorios de pasamanería entre otros. Lleva en este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien, atiende con ayuda de su pareja. Por otra parte dedica su tiempo a trabajar como costurera. Está contenta con su trabajo ya que genera el dinero necesario para solventar los gastos de su familia, además el contacto con el público es lo que le hace sentir muy bien. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que nuevamente tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará los principales abarrotes de consumo diario que pone a la venta en su pequeña tienda como arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, leche, aceite, condimentos y otros.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 27, is married and has a three year old son.  She is currently pregnant with twins.  She lives with them in her own house.  Sandra’s business activity is selling food products in a store that is installed in the front part of her house.  She tends to her customers every day starting very early.  She sells basic needs items like rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, cooking oil, condiments, and decorative trimmings, among others.  

She has been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her.  She tends to the business with help from her life partner.  She also spends her time working as a seamstress.  She is happy with her work because it generates the money needed to pay for her family’s expenses.  Also, the contact with the public is what makes her feel very good.

She will now request 3,000 soles.  She is grateful to all of the people who continue placing their trust in her so that she can once again access a loan that will help her increase her working capital.  She knows that she will once again have to be very responsible, and above all, very punctual with her payments.

She will use the requested loan to buy groceries that are consumed daily, which she will sell in her small store.  She will buy things like rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, cooking oil, condiments, and more.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, cooking oil, condiments, and more.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married, has seven children and resides in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps to operate their garden to make a living.

In 2008, she joined GDMPC and has successfully repaid her previous loans that have been used on their farm. She borrowed again another loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to gain a more abundant harvest in return. She wants and hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is 58 years old, married, and has six children.  

Luvisminda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Luvisminda requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers salaries during harvest and for land preparation.

Luvisminda has been doing this for 40 years now, and has borrowed 34 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luvisminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries during harvest and for land preparation.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and has eight children. Elizabeth is married and has three children who are in school.

Elizabeth is in an agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. Elizabeth has been raising livestock for 5 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is a hard-working agronomist from the village Khot in the Syuniq region. He lives with his mother, father, wife and two small children (a 4-year-old daughter and 5-year-old son). Arsen is currently a taxi driver, but his earnings do not support his large family. 

To be able to meet the family's daily needs, Arsen also breeds cows, sheep, piglets and hens. He is also involved in beekeeping. Arsen and his family are cultivating some wheat, barley, beans, potatoes, grass and nuts. Those are the main sources of the family’s income. As their needs increase day by day, Arsen wants to increase the amount of cattle he owns by buying two more calves. To reach that goal he needs a loan of $1,000 USD. 

Arsen has previously taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back because the family faced difficulties. However, thanks to their recent hard work, Arsen is able to run his agribusiness in a way that ensures that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The lenders will provide great support to Arsen and his family by giving them an opportunity to receive the loan and to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is married woman with four children who all attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years she has operated a retail shop and a green grocery business.  She sells to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Elina dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 80,000 KES she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka, a hardworking and enterprising woman, lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.


Mwaka has operated a clothes-selling business for the past two years, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of inflation in her business. 


With this Kshs 15,000 loan, Mwaka wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 45 year old woman from the town of Trinidad in the province of Bohol. She is married with three children ages 4, 9 and 17. Alicia operates a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sell basic household commodities such as rice, sugar, canned goods and toiletries. She also farms rice for extra income. With these businesses she is able to help her husband who works selling and at a bread delivery service.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sardines, sugar and also fertilizer for her farm. Her profit will be used for her family's daily consumption and to pay for school. 

Alicia hopes that her children will be successful in their studies in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sardines, sugar and fertilizer

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old and from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with nine children.

For seven years now, Cecilia has been engaged in making, buying and selling dried fish for a living while her husband also catches fish to add more income. She wanted to make the best of her business for her family's welfare. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. Any additional capital will make her more productive.

She works hard in order to provide for her family. In the future, she would like to see her children become successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina, who lives in the Philippines, is married to a farmer and has two children. In addition to farming, Cristina operates a vegetable garden to earn a living. 


A member of GDMPC since 2011, Cristina has repaid her previous loans that she used for farm inputs. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to finance weeding labor costs. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to finance weeding labor costs

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is the age of 40 and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 6 children: three of them go to school, one of them is doing a job in a firm, and two of them are helping their father to look after their restaurant activity.

Her husband has been running a restaurant successfully for many years and handling the financial conditions of his house. This restaurant has been maintaining her whole family for many years. She has been investing the amount of previous loans in the current business and has been establishing the restaurant well. She is an old member of BRAC Pakistan and now she is in her 7th loan cycle. Her payment schedule and behavior is so good.

This time Zareena is taking a larger loan than earlier for the establishment of a restaurant. In fact, the restaurant needs whitewash, a little bit of maintenance, saucepans for cooking and crockery as well.  Zareena is hopeful after taking this loan because it would become the cause to get more profit and savings as well.

Zareena says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, pulses and vegetables for restaurant

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
This is Luz. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy all the needed products for her variety store. She still has one child who goes to school and her loan also helps in her education. Her income from loan is assisting in their household expenses.

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luz dreams that her business will continue to grow, and hopes to help her children financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 31 years old and married to a farmer who owns a farm located in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

For the past ten years, they have been growing and harvesting coconuts and bananas to sell and earn a living. She joined GDMPC in 2008 and recently, Angelita borrowed a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to cultivate their land to generate more harvest in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
From the town of San Miguel, Bohol, Efrena is a 52-year-old married mother of eight children ranging in age from 7 to 30 years. For seven years now, Efrena has been selling gasoline, earning an average income of 8000 PHP per month.


Efrena is requesting a loan of 12000 PHP to buy more gasoline to resell. She is confident that with additional capital, she can maximize her profit while supporting the needs of her children. 


In the future, Efrena hopes to maintain her business and be open to other opportunities to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy gasoline

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arlene hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Salmo 121 Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una de los integrantes del grupo salmo 121, ellos dieron este nombre a su grupo ya que es una alabanza bíblica que les gusta, este grupo esta integrado por 5 personas alegres y emprendedoras cada una de ella desarrolla una actividad económica con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida, este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad de nombre Huixcolotla donde las principales fuentes de empleo se encuentran en el campo en la ganadería y el cultivo de caña de azúcar. 

Doña Rosa tiene 37 años, solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Julian con el cual tiene 4 hijos, ella platica que su esposo aprendió el oficio de carpintero hace algunos años cuando estuvo trabajando en estados unidos y al regresar a su pueblo decidió poner una carpintería para tener su propia fuente de empleo, ella comenta que los trabajan muy fuerte en su taller de carpintería para sacar a delante a sus hijos y a futuro poder brindarles mejores oportunidades de estudio. Ellos se dedican a la elaboración de muebles (mesas, camas, sillas, libreros, cajoneras, roperos, ventanas y puertas)y trabajan sobre los pedidos que sus clientes acuden hacerles, ellos ya tienen 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y durante este tiempo se han ganado a sus clientes a base de su trabajo ya que le ponen mucho empeño a cada mueble que hacen ya que saben que alegrara a una familia.
Un credito de Vision Fund le ayudara a compra de madera, clavos, resistol, pijas, barnices y dar mantenimiento al equipo para continuar con su actividad.
ella espera que su negocio continue progresando y a futuro le gustaria que su negocio fuera mas familiar y sus hijos aprendieran este oficio.
los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Benjamin venta de limon
Lucio venta de cerdos
Azahel cultivo de caña
Elena reposteria
texts.en:
Doña Rosa es una de los integrantes del grupo salmo 121, ellos dieron este nombre a su grupo ya que es una alabanza bíblica que les gusta, este grupo esta integrado por 5 personas alegres y emprendedoras cada una de ella desarrolla una actividad económica con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida, este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad de nombre Huixcolotla donde las principales fuentes de empleo se encuentran en el campo en la ganadería y el cultivo de caña de azúcar. 

Doña Rosa tiene 37 años, solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Julian con el cual tiene 4 hijos, ella platica que su esposo aprendió el oficio de carpintero hace algunos años cuando estuvo trabajando en estados unidos y al regresar a su pueblo decidió poner una carpintería para tener su propia fuente de empleo, ella comenta que los trabajan muy fuerte en su taller de carpintería para sacar a delante a sus hijos y a futuro poder brindarles mejores oportunidades de estudio. Ellos se dedican a la elaboración de muebles (mesas, camas, sillas, libreros, cajoneras, roperos, ventanas y puertas)y trabajan sobre los pedidos que sus clientes acuden hacerles, ellos ya tienen 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y durante este tiempo se han ganado a sus clientes a base de su trabajo ya que le ponen mucho empeño a cada mueble que hacen ya que saben que alegrara a una familia.
Un credito de Vision Fund le ayudara a compra de madera, clavos, resistol, pijas, barnices y dar mantenimiento al equipo para continuar con su actividad.
ella espera que su negocio continue progresando y a futuro le gustaria que su negocio fuera mas familiar y sus hijos aprendieran este oficio.
los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Benjamin venta de limon
Lucio venta de cerdos
Azahel cultivo de caña
Elena reposteria

Doña Rosa is a member of the Psalm 121 group. The group chose its name because it is a piece of biblical praise that they liked. This group is made up of five happy, enterprising people, each one of which pursues an economic activity with the goal of improving their quality of life. This group is located in a community called Huixcolotla where the main sources of employment are raising livestock and growing sugarcane.

Doña Rosa is 37 years old; she was able to study only until secondary school. She has four children with her husband, Julian, who learned the carpentry trade when he was working in the United States. When Julian returned home, he decided to open his own carpentry business. Rosa says that they work very hard in the workshop to support their children and provide them with better academic opportunities in the future. They specialize in making furniture (tables, beds, bookshelves, chests of drawers, armoires, windows and doors) and in special orders from customers. They have ten years of experience in the business and during this time they have built their clientele based on the quality of their work; they put significant amounts of time and effort into each piece because they know it will brighten the lives of the family who uses it. 
A loan from Vision Fund will help Rosa and Julian purchase wood, nails, contact glue, wood screws and varnish, and to maintain their equipment. This will allow them to continue their business; Rosa hopes that it will keep growing and that someday their children will work alongside them. 
The other members of the group are:
Benjamin, lime sales
Lucio, pig sales
Azahel, sugarcane farming
Elena, bakery

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, contact glue, wood screws and varnish, and to maintain equipment.

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for her children.

Mariafe runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock, including chips, spices, milk, sugar, and eggs.

In the future, Mariafe would like to build and expand her business and ensure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock, including chips, spices, milk, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Johny Lou

texts.en: Johny Lou is a fourth-year student at Misamis University in Ozamiz City. He is studying civil engineering. His dream is to finish his studies and be able to got a job. He joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed 14,000 PHP to use for his tuition fees this semester. He is thankful to his parents that despite some obstacle in their lives, they still support him in his studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is from the village of Avshar in the Ararat region. Her family consists of her husband, her school-age daughter (7 years old) and her small son (four years old). Ani works in the kindergarten as an educator. She and her husband try to earn a living for their family. However, the low salaries are not enough to meet the basic needs of their family. 

Ani and her husband are involved in horticulture as well. This is an important source of income for them. They grow peaches, apricots and apples. Ani's husband helps her to sell the fruit in the local market. As life gets more expensive day by day, Ani wants to find new sources of income. 

A loan of $3,000 USD will help her to buy a cow, fertilizer and tractor fuel.  It will also help to pay for the water bills and to pay for the workforce to be able to continue the growing and the harvesting of the fruit.

As this is Ani's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Ani and her family depend on the goodwill of the lenders and are very thankful to them.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fertilizer and tractor fuel and to pay for water and a farm workforce

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Mr. Amado is a single man who lives in Brgy. Miputak, Dipolog city, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 37 years old.

Mr. Amado has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since September 12, 2012. He is a good person and he helps his parents in their daily needs. Mr. Amado availed a loan last year amounting to PHP 5,000 to use as a beginning capital for his canteen. 

Mr. Amado availed a new loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to use for his additional capital. To improve his living, Mr. Amado used his new loan availed to buy goods for his canteen. His business activity is buying and selling.

loans.use: to buy goods for his canteen.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is married. For the past twelve years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.  

Angie is requesting a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock, including chips, bread, soft drinks, and candy. In the future, Angie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, including chips, bread, soft drinks, and candy

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is married and has four school-going children. Her house lacks electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nadzuwa has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past eight years. She sells from her home to her neighbors. Nadzuwa is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000, which will be used to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocer in the future.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over three years she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Don Emiliano, tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado, vive  con su esposa y un hijo en el municipio de La Masica, Atlántida.  Por muchos años se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva plátano, palma, lichas  y chiles. También vende leche de unas vacas que tiene.  Ha obtenido cinco ciclos de préstamos en ODEF con el actual que es por 25,000  Lempiras, este préstamo  lo va invertir en la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra para la siembra de chile tabasco picante. Este préstamo le ayudara a tener un ingreso más y satisfacer las necesidades de la familia y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Don Emiliano is 58 years old, married, and lives with his wife and son in the town of La Masica, Atlántida.  He has been farming for many years.  Emiliano grows bananas, palm fruit, rambutan, and chili peppers.  He also sells milk since he owns a few dairy cows.  

Emiliano has received five loans from ODEF.  His current loan is in the amount of 25,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase supplies and the payment of labor for planting spicy Tabasco chili peppers.  This loan will help him generate more income, satisfy the needs of his family, and enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Norleta

texts.en:
This is Norleta, 56, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

She operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Norleta is requesting a Php35,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

She hopes to expand her business and have other sources of income. She dreams of being successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Samtredia district with her husband and two infant children. She graduated from teaching college and works as a teacher at the local public school. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family. 

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps residents to make a living. The family is involved in the husbandry business. They have three cows and produce dairy products to sell. Additionally, they have a plot of agricultural land where watermelon is grown. They sell the harvested watermelon seasonally. 

With the loan of $2,500 USD, Natia will build a mill and will get orders to grind corn. Natia hopes that the business will be successful, as there are many families who grow corn in their village. It is obvious that the job will be hard, as she has no experience in this field. However, she and her husband are ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. 

Natia decided to start this family business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times because she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit through a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased with help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a mill.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is from the village of Kvirike,  in the Adjara Region. She is 22 years old and works as a waitress at the local café. Her monthly wage is approximately $240. Diana is married and lives with her child, spouse and parents. Her father runs small scale agricultural business and grows maize and nuts on the family-owned plot of land. He also is involved animal husbandry business and breeds pigs. 

The existing family funds are modest and hardly enough to cover food and every day expenses. That is the reason why Diana decided to start a clothing trading business. She has no experience in this field but hopes she will cope with all the difficulties and generate a good income since there are not many clothing stores in her district. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices and sell them among her coworkers and community members. She will be very nice to her customers and do her job with love and care.

Diana will be able to earn more income and make savings to satisfy the everyday needs of her family members. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
Rodalyn is 37 years old and married with five children who are in school. Rodalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rodalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, noodles, egg, etc.

Rodalyn has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Rodalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Chola's Group

texts.en:
Chola, a 40-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children. One of them is still in school and dependent on her. To make a living, Chola has been selling groceries for two years. 

Her group consists of four members applying for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the second cycle loan for Chola and she has successfully repaid the first. The past loan has improved her family's living conditions. 

As the leader of this group, Chola will use her portion to buy grocery items for her business. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income so that she can further expand her business to triple her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Jun Mart

texts.en: Jun Mart resides in Calabayan, Ozamiz City, along with his family. His parents worked as government employees to earn a living. Jun Mart is studying for his Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration, and is in his fourth year at Misamis University. He joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan to be used for payment of his school tuition fees for the first semester. He is hopeful of getting a job in the future that is related to his degree, and that he is able to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her family in Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in making and selling salted fish, and in buying and selling fresh fish. This business has existed for 10 years now. 

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish and salt for her business. She hopes that with the help of the loan her family's living standards will improve and that the profitability of her business will increase in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and salt.

loans.name: Mafia's Group

texts.en:
Mafia is a 36-years old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She owns a beauty parlor on partnership. Her partner is expert in hair style and cutting; she is expert in makeovers. Both are fully professional in their arts. She provides makeover services to her clients at home also. Most of their clients belong to the neighborhood and her clients appreciate her artistry. With the passage of time her beauty products are almost used up and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Mafia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion etc. She wants to establish a separate parlor in a nearby town because she has to divide the profit amount into two equal parts. Mafia says thanks to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina is 41 years old and she is married with three children. All her children attend school. She is a businesswoman and she has a grocery store in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for five years now and she learned about Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages for her business. In five years time she wants to be running two more stores that will increase her income. The challenge that she faces is the cost of goods which at times is so high. The extra income that she raises will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Verma June

texts.en: Verma June is 34 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, bread, coffee, spices, soft drinks, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Verma June would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, bread, coffee, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Lora

texts.en:
Lora is 53 years old and lives in the Samtredia district. She works as a cleaner at a ceremonial hall and gets small monthly income. Lora’s income is too small and she has decided to request a loan to start a clothing business. She has been seeking credit among local financial institutions but her attempts have been unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

Lora is requesting a 900 USD loan to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and resell it to community members door-to-door. Her customers will be her coworkers and neighbors. Lora’s loan application has been approved under the framework of a loan program between Kiva and Credo. This joint initiative enables the rural poor and inexperienced to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. Lora plans to sell a wide assortment or well-priced clothing for men, women and children. It is obvious that this job will be hard for Lora, but she is ready to deal with her difficulties and gradually develop her business. The Start Up credit will be a great support for her as her income will be significantly increased.

loans.use: to begin a clothing business

loans.name: Gabriela De Los Angeles

texts.es: Una joven de 23 años es Gabriela, quien no trabaja actualmente, estudia la carrera de Ing. en sistemas y también un postgrado en innovación y estrategia de negocios, su objetivos es culminar sus estudios para optar por un empleo digno y apoyar a su madre así a como la ha venido ayudado ella en cubrir sus gastos de estudios. Gabriela solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de postgrado que está estudiando.
texts.en: Gabriela is a 23-year-old young woman who is not working at the moment. She is studying systems engineering and also a postgraduate degree in innovation and business strategy. Her goals are to finish her studies in order to get a good job and support her mother, as her mother has helped her cover her study expenses. Gabriela is requesting the loan in order to pay for the postgraduate course she is studying.

loans.use: to pay for a postgraduate course

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
