This loan will be used toward repairing his bathroom since it's in bad shape and in great need of repair. Due to a lack of resources, he hasn't been able to repair it.

In the future, he hopes to continue working with the Fundación Campo because so far, it seems like an institution that seeks to provide support to people and develop rural communities.

loans.use: to repair his bathroom

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica, de 29 años está casada con Heber quien es padre de sus 03 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. El negocio de Verónica consiste en el alquiler de mototaxis, a diario van a su casa dos personas en busca de alquilarle sus unidades móviles. Lleva realizando éste negocio hace más de 03 años y le ha permitido tener un ingreso adicional ya que también trabaja como personal administrativo en una municipalidad de la ciudad. Le está yendo bien en su negocio y al mismo tiempo en su trabajo ya que percibe dos ingresos y eso le permite tener algunas comodidades en su hogar al mismo tiempo de apoyar a sus hijos quienes aun están estudiando y necesitan de bastantes materiales para poder realizar sus estudios de manera adecuada. Espera poder seguir haciendo éste negocio, para más adelante incrementar su flota con algunos vehículos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Además está muy comprometida en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 soles, comprará piezas y repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus vehículos que se encuentran deteriorados por el uso constante y el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Verónica, 29 years old, is married to Heber, who is father of their three children. They live together in their own home. Verónica's business consists of mototaxi rentals. Every day, two people come to her home to rent her vehicles. She has been running this business for more than 3 years, and it has allowed her to bring in additional income, as she also works as administrative staff in one of the city's municipalities. 

It works well for her to have her business and her job at the same time, as her two incomes allow her to have a few amenities in her home at the same time as supporting her children, who are still in school and need quite a few supplies to be able to do their schoolwork properly. She hopes to continue with this business, to later increase her fleet with a few more vehicles. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is very happy to know that she has some financial support, as this way she feels sure she can advance her business. As well, she is very committed to making her repayments. With the requested 800 soles, she will purchase replacement parts for the maintenance of her vehicles, which have deteriorated over time due to constant use.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Nikel Group

texts.en:
Ismaili is in his early 30s and is married with three children who are still in school.  He has had a business making keys since 2004.  He works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more and better materials to make more keys.  He has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay for the children's school fees, bought a cupboard and covered household expenses.  He is doing very well.  He will use this loan to buy more materials to make more keys.  He dreams of building his own house.

Ismaili will share this loan with his loan group Nikel which has nine members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make more keys.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is from the village of Karaleti where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children, who have not yet reached school age. She is 26 years old and earns a living through clothing sales. Specifically, she buys apparel and household items at capital city open market and sells them among her community members. Since there are not many clothing stores, Tamar's business has high demand. Tamar has been a clothing vendor for the past year and during this time she has gained enough skills and experience to run the business. She has applied for this loan in order to continue her business and to purchase a supply of clothing and household items at wholesale prices in Sarpi open market (near the Turkish border) where prices are lower than in other parts of Georgia. Tamar will be able to get more profits and make savings to satisfy the everyday needs of her family members. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of clothing and household items for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with nine children.  One of her children is young, six are in school and two are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has operated a shoe-selling business for the past five years. She sells from her shoe shop to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the 50,000 Kenya Schilling (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of shoes for resale

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex, de 28 años de edad, está casado con María y tiene un hijo de un año con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Alex es el transporte de pasajeros, contando para eso con una motataxi  que compró inicialmente para el transporte de carga de plátano de los fundos vecinos, esta unidad móvil lo compró con su propio capital, pero  por la demanda de pasajeros decidió empezar a transportar personas, haciendo su ruta por las carreteras de la ciudad.  Vienen realizando está actividad por más de tres años. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite recorre,  conocer diversos lugares y zonas de la ciudad, además de los ingresos económicos que le genera para solventar los gastos de su familia. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, desea invertir en la compra de 04 llantas  para su vehiculo de esa manera seguirá trabajando con normalidad y teniendo más ingresos.
texts.en:
Alex, 28 years old, is married to Maria and has a one-year-old son with whom he lives in his own house. Alex transports passengers, using a mototaxi that he initially purchased to transport plantains from neighbouring estates. He bought this vehicle with his own capital, but because of the demand from passengers he decided to start transporting people instead, making his way through the city's streets. He has been doing this for more than three years. 

He enjoys his work because it allows him to wander, getting to know different places and areas of the city, as well as because of the income it provides him to cover his family's expenses. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support that he receives to move forward. Additionally, he promises to make his repayments punctually. With the requested 1,000 nuevos soles, he wants to invest in the purchase of 4 tires for his vehicle to continue working as usual and earning more income.

loans.use: to purchase 4 tires for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and father-in-law in the Sachkhere district. Her father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Tamar and her husband are unemployed. They have rented a commercial space, which is the only source of income for the family. As the income is too small and not enough to cover everyday costs, Tamar decided to request a loan and start a clothing-trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

With the loan of $700 she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in her community door-to-door. Her regular customers will be her neighbors. She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children. It is obvious that the job is hard for Tamar, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to begin trading clothing

loans.name: Ayowubo's Group

texts.en:
Ayewubo, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school and she has a little sister.
Ayewubo has been running a clothing material shop for eighteen years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her third loan request from ID-Ghana, which she will use to buy different clothing materials so that she can attract more customers. Ayewubo used the previous loans to buy materials to sell and has repaid all her previous loans successfully. With the business returns received, she managed to cover household expenses and school fees. She also bought a TV and fridge.

Her dreams are that one day, she will be able to buy land and build a house. 

She, together with the other two members of her group, who are into provisions and flowers, will need a total loan amount of 2,700 GHS. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy different clothing materials so that she can attract more customers.

loans.name: Look To We Group

texts.en:
Dauda is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Dauda was born in Lungi, a town in northern Sierra Leone, 35 years ago. He is married to an entrepreneur and the couple has 3 children, 2 of whom are attending primary schools. 

For 8 years now, Dauda has been selling used clothes. With the help of this loan, Dauda and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve upon their living conditions. Dauda will use his share of the loan (2,000,000 SLL) to expand his business: he will buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock of used clothes

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es: Pascuala, de 41 años, está casada con Bernabé y tiene 2 hijos de 07 y 04 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Todos los días Pascuala  se dirige al mercado central de la ciudad en donde están los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, realiza su inventario y hace la lista de las distintas verduras como son papas,  yucas, tomates, entre otros. Cuando está en el mercado ordena, almacena y exhibe sus productos. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 05 años y hasta el momento lo hace sola. Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando éste negocio se dio cuenta que a los clientes les gusta las verduras de primera calidad por ello se esfuerza en dar lo mejor.  Siempre esta con una sonrisa  ya que sabe que esta saliendo adelante  y ve crecer su negocio. Espera seguir manteniendo su negocio y  el momento preciso para poder empezar expandirlo. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos.  Por otro lado, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará papas, yucas, tomates, entre otros, para tener una variedad de verduras para la venta.
texts.en: Pascuala is 41 years old, married to Bernabé, and has two children ages 7 and 4 with whom she lives in their own home. Every day Pascuala goes to the city's central market where the products she sells her customers are located, she takes inventory, and makes a list of the distinct vegetables such as potatoes, yucca, tomatoes and others. When she is in the market she arranges, stocks, and displays her products. She has been working this position for 5 years and up until now, alone. During this time she realized that the customers like top quality vegetables therefore she tries to provide the best. She always has a smile and knows that she is successful and sees her business growing. She hopes to continue maintaining her business and at the right time, begin to expand it. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes the collaboration will help her continue with her goals. She promises to to be punctual with her loan payments. With the solicited loan of 3500 soles, she will buy potatoes, yucca, tomatoes, and other vegetables in order to have a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potatoes, yucca, tomatoes and others.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old and married with one child. Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like snack foods, bread, biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store.

Lucia has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, bread, biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. 

Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like snack foods, bread, biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 44-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Marilyn has a sewing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business (needles, fabric, threads, etc.).

Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials (fabric, threads, etc.).

loans.name: Fatoma's Group

texts.en:
Fatoma is a 40 year old Iraqi woman. She is from the south of the country where she lives with her 3 children whom she is raising alone since the death of her husband. As a widow with limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home.  She uses her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 10 years experience primarily making dresses for women and children and occasionally other fabric household items. To improve her work conditions and ensure she can work during the hours when there is no electricity provided in her area, she would like to buy a generator and also a new sewing machine. To pay for these purchases she is taking a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor.  These borrowers would otherwise be unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a generator and also a new sewing machine

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 34 years old and married.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Michelle buys and sells Coca-Cola products in the Philippines.  Michelle requested a PHP 18,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy an additional case of Coca-Cola products to sell.  Michelle has been in this business for 4 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional Coca-Cola products to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with four children, two of whom attend school.  She has one additional family member.  She sells soft drinks at a rented location in the market and has been in business for 20 years.  She works seven days a week.  

Juliet has applied for a loan amount of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO.  She plans to buy crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, passion fruits, oranges, and pineapples.  Her major business challenges include transportation and electricity.  She aspires to open a soda and beer depot and also to build a permanent business premises.  She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, boxes  of mineral water, passion fruits, oranges and pineapples.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 5 years. She offers various goods of everyday use. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to the family income since her husband’s income is insufficient to support his family alone. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to expand her business so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items such as oil, sugar and grains to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items such as oil, sugar and grains.

loans.name: Servanda

texts.en:
Servanda works hard to support her family. Servanda is married, and she has a dry goods business in the Philippines.

Servanda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell.

Servanda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Servanda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Da

texts.en: Da is a citizen from a rural area located in Kampong Thom Province. She is 54 years old and also one of the breadwinners in her family that consists of seven children. A daughter of hers is studying at university. Da grows rice on two hectares of her farmland as her main source of income while her husband works for others to earn extra income. She has been engaged in the business for 30 years. Da has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for seven cycles with a complete repayment history. The previous loan helped her to keep her child in school. Now, she is applying for a loan in order to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter's schooling. Da hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to graduate from university and thus help her to obtain a higher education background so that she can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter's schooling.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 33 years old and lives in the town of Dansoman, in the Accra region of Ghana.  She has one child who is currently in school.  For the past 8 years, Barbra has been working hard to manage her retail shop selling second hand clothing. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of GHS 1,200 from ID-Ghana.  The loan will be used to purchase one bale of towels to sell.  This will help Esther to generate greater profits and to take care of her child, in addition to other basic needs.  Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of towels.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for six years now and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, age 33, deals in the work of sewing clothes. She has been in this line of work for five years now, and she is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When Bushra was not earning, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her sewing skills in a productive manner. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That is why she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase a new sewing machine along with some spools of threads in different colors. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine along with some spools of threads in different colors

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина 32 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети еще маленькие. Зарина заботливая мать для своих детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом, то есть купле продажей детской одеждой. Несмотря на то, что Зарина имеет маленькое дитя, она помогает своему мужу. Двое детей Зарины учатся в лицее и являются отличниками. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своих детей в лицее. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 1050 долларов США для оплаты учебы детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarina is 32 and married and raising three young children. She is a caring mother to her children. Her husband has a business buying and selling children's clothing. Despite the fact that Zarina has a small child, she helps her husband. Two of her children are at school and doing very well. Zarina needs to pay for their school tuition. To this end she is requesting a loan of $1,050 USD to pay for their education costs. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 39 years old and married with ten children. They all live in the Compound #3 area of Grand Bassa County. Her children's ages range from 6 months old to 14 years old. Among her children, only eight are in school. For the past five years, she has been running a table where she sells red oil. Some problems that she is facing are customers complaining about the high price of food. She says she makes a lot of profit since she sells fresh red oil. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She is requesting a loan to buy more red oil for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is 40 years old and a married woman.  She has been in the business of running a beauty parlor for about two years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials.  

Over time she has attained a list of regular customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time.  For this, she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 through the Kashf Foundation.  She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history. 

She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Watch U Naiba Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Memunatu was born in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone 42 years ago. She is married to a businessman, and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary school. 

For 10 years now, Memunatu has been selling soft drinks, ginger, plastic water bottles, etc. This is the first loan that Memunatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve upon their living conditions. Memunatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy crates of drinks, bundles of plastic water bottles, dozens of ginger, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks, bundles of plastic water bottles, dozens of ginger, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Naly

texts.es:
Naly, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Abdias y tiene 02 hijos. Juntos viven cómodamente instalados en su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos de 18 y 04 años de edad. Naly se dedica a la venta de comidas, para eso tiene un pequeño puesto ubicado al frente de un hospital, donde atiende con variados platos de la región y menús a su distinguida clientela, levantándose muy temprano para realizar las compras de sus ingredientes para la preparación del día. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, ya que lo ha visto crecer iniciándose  con la venta de jugos, pasando  a la venta de comidas en una mesa ambulatoria, ahora contando con un local, sabiéndose ganar un buena clientela. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles comprará los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, tales como arroz, verduras y carnes al por mayor buscando precios más cómodos para sus compras.
texts.en:
Naly, 48, is married to Abdias and has two children. Together they live comfortably in their own home with their two children, aged 4 and 18. Naly sells food for a living; she has a small stall located at the front of a hospital where she offers an assortment of regional dishes and menus to her distinguished customers. She rises very early to buy her ingredients for the day. She likes her business because it has given her a lot of personal and financial satisfaction, since she has seen it expand: she initially started by selling juice, then she moved on to selling food as a street vendor, and now she has a food stall, which she knows will gain her a good customer base. This is her first loan with Kiva; therefore, she hopes to be able to fulfill her goals with this small loan. 

With the requested amount of 800 PEN, she will buy ingredients for food preparation such as rice, vegetables, and meat wholesale, searching for the most convenient prices for her purchases.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Ma. Silvina

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Ma. Silvina works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. Ma. Silvina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her business. Ma. Silvina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of sewing for many years. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. She has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Tahira requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and needles so she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.en:
Tinatin is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village in Gurjaani district with her husband and three children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard, two cows and two calves. Tinatin milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. 

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants make a living. So, Tinatin decided to start a clothes trading business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Tinatin’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

Tinatin received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the Start Up Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of 500 GEL, Tinatin will purchase clothes at wholesale price and sell them in her community door-to-door. It is obvious that the job is hard for Tinatin, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. 

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. 

Regards to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to begin trade with clothing by purchasing clothes at wholesale price and selling them in her community.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 41-year-old married woman. She has three children and is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. 

She is in the business of sewing clothes with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. By this time, they have attained regular customers. 

Currently, Asia applied for her second loan of PKR 30,000. With this loan, she will be able to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and needles, so they would be able to meet the demands of their customers without fail.

She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Doña Martha vive en una zona rural del departamento de Chontales,se dedica a elaborar tortillas a base de maíz, las que vende de manera diaria en su comunidad, adicionalmente 4 veces a la semana vende comida casera y sopas con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, sus dos hijos pequeños asisten a la escuela todavía. Solicita este crédito para invertirlo en compra de insumos como maíz, leña, carne y granos básicos para su negocio, debido a que los últimos meses del año las ventas se mejoran y quiere estar abastecida para la demanda.
texts.en: Martha lives in a rural area in the department of Chontales. She makes tortillas from corn and sells them every day in her community. Four times per week she also sells homemade foods and soups, with the help of her oldest son. Her two younger children are still in school. She is requesting this loan to buy inputs such as corn, firewood, meat, and basic grains for her business. During the final months of the year, sales improve and she wants to be stocked up to meet demand.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, meat, and basic grains.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. 

Over time, they became popular in their community for providing good quality products. They make enough to meet the expenses of their two children. 

Currently, Parveen requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and grains to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and grains to meet the increasing demands at her store.

loans.name: Talompnu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Talompnu” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 1,200,000.00 SLL for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 
Margarette is the leader of this group. Margarette is 35-years-old, married with 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Margarette sells cigarettes, batteries, rice, palm-oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt and sugar.  Margarette has been doing this business for 8 years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, batteries, rice, palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, and sugar in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Don Vidal, habita con sus tres hijos y esposa en el municipio de Juigalpa del departamento de Chontales. Trabaja en el sector de la construcción como maestro de obra, con su salario cubre los gastos familiares de su familia. El propósito del crédito es comprar materiales de construcción como piedras canteras, cemento, arenilla y pago de mano de obra para la excavación de sumidero sanitario en su casa de habitación, para la construcción de un inodoro, puesto que actualmente usan una letrina. Con esta obra el señor Vidal brindará mejores condiciones e higiene a su familia.
texts.en: Vidal lives with his wife and three children in the community of Juigalpa in the department of Chontales. He works in the construction business as a foreman and he pays for his family's expenses with his salary. The purpose of the loan is to buy construction materials like quarry stone, cement and sand, and to pay for labour for the excavation of a sanitary sewer in his house in order to install a toilet, since they currently use a latrine. With this project, Vidal will provide better conditions and hygiene for his family.

loans.use: to buy quarry stone, cement and sand, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is from the village of Tkviavi, where she lives with her parents, grandparents and brother. She is 21 years old and has recently graduated from secondary school. Venera’s family doesn't have enough income to finance her education at the university, so she stays at home and helps her mother in taking care the family. 

The family members are involved in agricultural business and grow apples, tomatoes, and garlic on a family owned land. Part of the harvested products is sold from their house and the rest from the nearest town's open market. The income from the agricultural activities is seasonal, and that’s why Venera decided to start her own business to generate monthly income.

Venera has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing and household items at wholesale prices in Sarpi open market (near Turkish border) where prices are lower than they are in other parts of Georgia, and start a trading business. 

Venera will be able to get more profit and have savings to satisfy the everyday needs of her family members. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and household items to start a trading business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a widow with seven children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past five years, she has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. Her potential customers are town dwellers. She cites the high cost of maintenance as being her major challenge.

With the 120,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase another motorcycle to expand her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is 36 years old and the mother of six children. She enjoys doing hand embroidery. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. In order to meet its growing demand of embroidery, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from the Kashf foundation. In this way, she can manage to buy more frames, needles, sequins and threads in different colors.  She will be able to complete the orders of her customers on time which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, sequins and threads in different colors for embroidery.

loans.name: Anabela

texts.es:
Anabela es una joven de  de 20 años de edad.  Ella es soltera y  vive en el Caserío La Guadalupana, Aldea Chaquijyá, Sololá, Sololá, junto a sus padres y sus cuatro hermanos que trabajan juntos  apoyando al desarrollo  de la familia.  

Ella es una mujer trabajadora que actualmente se dedica a la agricultura cultivando tomillo, en parcelas que tienen con la familia  a unos pasos de su vivienda. Esto lo aprendió de sus padres desde niña ahora ella trabaja la mitad del día y la otra mitad estudia la profesión de maestra de educación primaria. Tiene 10 años de trabajar en el campo de la agricultura como independiente apoyando a sus padres económicamente para que ella pueda terminar el último año del colegio. De ese modo decide emprender su propio cultivo convirtiéndose en su principal fuente de ingresos.
Ella Ha visto que las ganancias que le genera su cultivo son buenas, de este modo quiere ampliar su cultivo solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,500.00 para la compra de semillas de tomillo y abono orgánico, que necesita para cultivar y luego tener ventas exitosas mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
Ella tiene como sueño seguir ampliando su cultivo ayudando a su familia y mejorar condiciones de vida, también apoyar a sus demás hermanos para que sigan estudiando y terminar una carrera académica.
texts.en:
Anabela is 20 years old. She is single and lives in the small town of La Guadalupana, in Chaquijyá, in Sololá, Sololá, along with her parents and four siblings. They all work together to support the family.

She is a hardworking person and currently works in agriculture, planting thyme on parcels of land owned by her family that are just a few steps from their house. She’s learned this from her parents since she was a child. She now works half the day and spends the other half studying to be a primary school teacher. She has been working independently in agriculture for 10 years, helping her parents economically so that she could finish her last year of high school. This was how she decided to start her own crop and make it her main source of income. 

She has seen that her crop generates a good income. So, she wants to expand cultivation by requesting a loan of GTQ 4,500.00 (Guatemalan Quetzales) to buy tomillo seeds and organic fertilizer. She needs these for planting so she can have successful sales and improve her income, along with her family.

Her dream is to continue expanding her crop and helping her family improve its living conditions. She also wants to support her siblings so they can continue studying and finish their academic studies.

loans.use: to buy thyme seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Simplicia earns additional income from raising livestock. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetables vending business.

Simplicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en: Mnyazi is asking for a loan because she believes that with it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money to open this new tailoring business. However, she still operates her maize selling business. She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan which, to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits and to help her family cover their personal expenses. The loan of 40,000 KES that she is requesting will help her to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
A married mother of one child living in the Baray district of Kampong Thom Province, Sou is 63 years old. Her child is still in school. To make a living, she sells grocery items while her husband is a paid worker. She and her husband have been in this business for 28 years.

Sou has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her son’s university tuition. She hopes that this loan will enable her to keep her son in school until graduation and also help to relieve the financial burdens on her family thereby allowing her to sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She realizes that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household as well as the educational needs of their children. So, she and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupee (PKR) to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 38-year-old vigorous lady. She has been doing a business of tailoring for the past five years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community, and uses the income to support her entire family. 

By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers, but due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

Robina intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. 

She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Tsotne

texts.en: Tsotne is 24 years old. He lives in the village of Dzevri with his mother and a brother. Tsotne leads the family agricultural business. Specifically, he owns five cows and sells the dairy products locally. In addition, he has a vineyard and produces wine to sell with the harvested grapes. Tsotne requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a fast food business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of a lack of experience in this field. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Tsotne will purchase all the needed equipment and the stock of raw materials to make doner. He will start the café and hopes his business will be profitable as there is not a similar café nearby. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a fast food cafe and sell doner

loans.name: Ma. Trecia

texts.en: Ma. Trecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Trecia requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to resell in her general store. She has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Ma. Trecia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia, age 23, deals in the business of animals’ sales and purchase. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market for profit. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  She also sells milk to generate an extra source of income. She needs to improve her business to generate more income. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 23-year-old single lady. The income generated by her father is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. 

At the present, she has five cows and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda  es una joven de  de 23  años de edad.  Ella es soltera y  vive en el Caserío La Guadalupana, Aldea Chaquijyá, Sololá, Sololá junto a sus padres y sus cuatro hermanos trabajando juntos  apoyando a la economía de la familia.  
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando tomillo en parcelas que tienen con la familia  al rededor de su vivienda. Esto lo aprendió de sus padres desde niña cuando trabajaba la mitad del día y la otra mitad estudiaba. Tiene ahora 10 años de trabajar en el campo de la agricultura como independiente desde que termino el colegio, esto es  por la falta de oportunidades de empleo que existe, ella decide emprender su propio cultivo convirtiéndose ahora en su principal fuente de ingresos.
Ella Ha visto que las ganancias que le generan al trabajar en la agricultura son buenas de este modo quiere ampliar su cultivo solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,500.00 para la compra de semillas de tomillo y abono orgánico que necesita para cultivar y así tener ventas exitosas, mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
Ella tiene como sueño seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida,  así mismo apoyar a sus demás hermanos que aun estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a young lady of 23. She is single and lives in La Guadalupana Neighborhood, Chaquijyá Village, Sololá. She lives with her parents and her four siblings, working together to financially support their family.

She works in agriculture growing thyme on plots of land that her family has around their home. She learned to do this from her parents since she was a little girl, when she worked for half the day and studied during the other half. 

Now, she has been working independently in agriculture for 10 years since she finished school. Because of the lack of existing job opportunities, she decided to start her own farm, which has now become her principal source of income. 

She has seen that the earnings generated from working in farming are excellent. Therefore, she wants to expand her harvest by requesting a loan of 4,500.00 Q for the purchase of thyme seeds and organic fertilizer that she needs to farm and so have successful sales, improving her income alongside her family.  

Her dream is to continue working and helping out her family, improving their living conditions and likewise supporting her other siblings who are still studying in the community’s school.

loans.use: to purchase thyme seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is married with five children, and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for five years. She works six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation, seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and the ever increasing prices of green bananas. She is aspiring to get a delivery van to ease transportation and also to become a wholesaler.  

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en: Afuwa is married with six children and five of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second-hand shoes at the market as retail.  She has been in business for a few years and she works six days a week.  She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second hand shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality, especially during the rainy season, which hinders her movements and transportation. She aspires to buy a plot of land and get a permanent business premise.  She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 61 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Victoria has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 30 years. Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing the service of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past eight years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, Fozia requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 29-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for people in her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

Nazia intends to use this loan amount to buy cloth, threads, packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her complete the orders of her customers on time to generate healthier source of income. She wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cloth and threads, packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима очень оптимистичная, жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 36 лет. К сожалению в семейной жизни  ей не повезло, она не смогла родить ребенка и разошлась со своим мужем. Она хотела усыновить ребенка, но муж не согласился. В данный момент Халима проживает со своей матерью. У её братьев и сестер свои семьи. Чтобы прокормить себя и свою мать Халима торгует различными тканями на базаре своего района. От этой деятельности получает хорошую стабильную прибыль. Временами она может позволить себе покупать какие - нибудь угощения и относить детям детского дома, в районе, котором она проживает. Видя в их глазах радость, она чувствует себя счастливой. К сожалению, ей как матери одиночке, не дают усыновить ребенка, но она живет надеждами на лучшее. В выходные дни она берет 2-3 детей домой по очереди, чтобы они  таким образом по выходным почувствовали тепло домашнего очага. В доме, где она живет  со своей матерью  давно уже не делали ремонт. У неё пока не было средств для ремонта. Получаемую от своего бизнеса прибыль, Халима расходует на ежедневные нужды семьи. А для того, чтобы сделать в доме ремонт, ей необходима большая сумма денег. Поэтому Халима обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Halima is a very optimistic and happy 36-year-old woman.  Unfortunately, she hasn't been very lucky in her family life: she was unable to have a child and she and her husband got divorced.  Halima had wanted to adopt a child, but her husband had been opposed to it.  

Halima currently lives with her mother.  Her brothers and sisters have their own families.  In order to provide for herself and her mother, she sells various fabrics at the bazaar of her district, and she makes a good, stable income from this business.  At times, she can even afford to buy treats for herself and to bring some to the children of the local orphanage.  When she sees the joy in their eyes, she feels happy herself.  Unfortunately, because she is a single woman, she cannot adopt a child, but she still hopes for the best.  On weekends, she takes two or three children to her house so that they can feel the warmth of a real home.

The house in which Halima and her mother live together hasn't been repaired for a long time, because Halima has never had the financial means to perform any repair.  In fact, all the earnings from her business are spent to meet the daily needs of her family.  And in order to perform repairs, Halima would need a large amount of money.  

Halima has therefore turned to MDO Arvand to receive a loan for the purchase of building materials to repair her house.  She looks very forward to a positive outcome, and thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ESPERANZA,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Gladiz,  ella se dedica ala venta de lejía, la lejía es una especie de masa hecha de cenizas de quinua, maíz y estevia tiene distintos sabores, este producto acompaña a al pijchu de la tradicional hoja de coca, la Sra. Gladiz se dedica esta actividad hace bastante tiempo, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de este producto por mayor para brindar variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Gladiz se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le dan en la otorgación dl crédito.
texts.en:
Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man.

Gladiz is the president of the bank.  She earns a living selling "lejía," a sort of paste made of quinoa ashes, corn, and stevia.  This product comes in a variety of flavors and is used in the traditional consumption of the coca leaf.  Gladiz has worked in this job for some time.

She's requesting the loan to buy this product wholesale and sell a variety of products to her customers.

Gladiz is happy for the opportunity to be granted a loan.

loans.use: to buy "lejía" wholesale

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Vanadzor town with his grandmother, who is retired and doesn't work. As the only breadwinner of the family, Armen works really hard. He has been engaged in a retail business for two years already. Despite his young age (he is 20 years old), Armen is already very skilled. He purchases different types of fruits and vegetables from nearby villages, and sells them at a local city market.  

Now, for purchasing watermelons, this young and hardworking guy needs financial support. He has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Armen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Thus, this loan will greatly assist Armen to increase sales of watermelons and ensure a better life for his grandmother.

loans.use: to pay for an increase in working capital by purchasing watermelons.

loans.name: Mokhtiyaran

texts.en:
Mokhtiyaran is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a business purchasing and selling animals for the past 5 years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

Mokhtiyaran has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 22-year-old married lady. She is very talented and excels in making envelopes. She makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them in the local market. Her husband's income is not sufficient to meet the family expenditures alone so her income helps in providing for the household activities. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, Shameem is requesting a loan of 15,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper to increase her sales. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality papers.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 49 years old, and he lives with his family in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. He has a son and a daughter. His son temporarily lives and works in the Russian Federation; his daughter is married and lives separately with her family. Arsen’s wife works at the bread factory as a baker. Arsen himself has a specialty of being a builder, and for many years, he has worked in his specialty. Today, the main occupation that he is engaged in with his wife is farming and agriculture. He has a plot of land and some farm livestock (five cows, five piglets, three calves, five sheep and 20 chickens).

Arsen asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to be able to fence the grave of his father, who unfortunately died last year.

loans.use: to be able to fence the grave of his father, who unfortunately died last year.

loans.name: Sayeda Tasneem

texts.en:
Sayeda Tasneem is 28 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of two. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, and his income is insufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. That is why she started her business of stitching clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and has gained a lot of popularity in her community. 

Now, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and needles. So then she would be able to meet the demand of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Demetria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

Demetria has been raising livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Nzara dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is 57 years old and a married woman. Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed, so she started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She wants to expand her business, but because of the shortage of stitching material, she is facing a problem to meet her customers’ orders, so now she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy more spools of threads along with packs of laces, buttons and zippers. Then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads along with packs of laces, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (who is also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of salts, biscuits and grains to meet with the increasing demand at her store. Zubaida is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and grains.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat is a 34-year-old married woman. She is involved in the business of tailoring with her husband who is also shown in the photo. They have been in this business together for the past 8 years and make enough to meet the needs of their three children. At present, they enjoy a great client list and have gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in their community. 

To complete the orders of their customers on time, Rahat has applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. In this way she will be able to buy a stock of threads along with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. 

Rahat hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads along with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She prepares goat meat and soup using the head and legs from goats and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

Mwaka joined Yehu to boast her business. She will use the 40,000 KES from the loan to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is 45 years old, married with five children. Her eldest is 26 and her youngest is one year old. Celsa is engaged in hog raising as her way of helping her husband who is a carpenter. This business started five years ago, earning her 3000 PHP per month. Celsa is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets and supplements. 

It would be an opportunity for her to expand her business with the help of the loan. Celsa hopes to uplift her family's present living conditions with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and supplements

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Leonora has been in this business for 7 years and also earns income from her general store.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Las Comadres  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Comadres está formado por 11 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió y de muchos lugares turísticos tanto para disfrutar de la naturaleza como de su historia, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas amables y gentiles, que mantienen viva su cultura y tradiciones. Ellas tienen un objetivo en común que es la superación personal y familiar.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Gladys, está realizando su tercer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Las Comadres, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque en cada reunión se encuentra con sus compañeras y salen de sus rutinas diarias de trabajo.

La Señora. Gladys tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 11, 6 y 3 años, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Gladys desde hace 8 años tiene su propio negocio, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de calzado, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. Este trabajo le permite estar pendiente de su familia y aportar a la economía de su hogar.

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de calzado.

Su meta es tener su propio local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The credit group known as “Las Comadres” (The Godmothers) consists of 11 women who are friends and neighbors.  They live in the city of Cuenca.  This city experiences cold weather and has several tourist attractions where people can enjoy its natural beauty as well as its history.  Cuenca was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.   Just like its people, the members of this group are kind and gentle individuals who have maintained their culture and traditions.  Their common goal is to excel on a personal level and to help their families get ahead.  

One of the members of this group is Sra. Gladys.  She is participating in her third loan along with her friends and fellow group members of “Las Comadres”.  Gladys likes this form of credit because she gets to meet with the other group members and establish a daily work routine with them.  

Sra. Gladys is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 11, 6, and 3).  Her two oldest children attend a small school in the city.  Her husband works for a private company.  They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.  

Doña Gladys has managed her own business for eight years.  She sells shoes as a street vendor.  Gladys works Monday through Friday, but without a set schedule.  Her work enables her to look after her family and still contribute to the household finances.  The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes.  Her goal is to have her own shop where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: Binti appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 25,000 to buy more stocks of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 50 years old, married and has three children, two of whom attend school.

Manuela is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Manuela requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Manuela has been raising cattle for 30 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Manuela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
This is Nuru. She previously accessed a loan that she used to purchase materials for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. The profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Elvia

texts.es: Doña Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula.  Doña Rosa estuvo por años realizando trabajos de lavado de ropa a varias personas. Ahora tiene un año de tener su propia pulpería vendiendo refrescos, pollo, hot dog, churros, manteca, azúcar, dulces, pan  etc.  El  préstamo que solicita es por 7,500 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de cajas de jabón, pastillas, cereales, leche, pan, tarjetas para celulares etc. Este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio ofreciendo diferente variedad de productos. Su meta es construir su casa de bloque y comprar un vehículo
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is 52 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the town of San Pedro Sula.

Doña Rosa worked for many years by doing laundry for several different people.  She now has her own general store that she managed for the past year.  Rosa sells soft drinks, chicken, hot dogs, fried dough snacks, lard, sugar, sweets, bread, and other products.   

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 7.500 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of boxes of soap, pills, cereals, milk, bread, mobile phone cards, and other items.  This loan will help to strengthen her business so that she can offer a variety of products.  Her goals are to build a cement block house and to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, pills, cereals, milk, bread, mobile phone cards, and other items.

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is an old client married to Ephraim  with six children; they reside in the Nkongoro area in Ntungamo district. 

She applied for loan of ugx.3,000,000. She has a good banana plantation, and she wants to  buy mulching materials to improve it. She will also take her children to better schools with the loan she gets. 

Her dream is to see her plantation yield more bananas, locally called  "matooke". She would also want to buy her own transport van for ferrying the bananas to the market which she hopes to do with the help of the loan facilitation in the near future though she is still limited by capital, yet she has enough experience in her business. 

With this loan she is hopeful that her banana plantation will get a better yield and therefore increase the profits. 
Clare and the loan officer appear in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy mulch for her banana plantation

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a single father, aged thirty-seven years, with one daughter. He lives in a rural setting with his child. He is a businessman who deals in agriculture, specifically pineapple and coffee growing. He works six days a week, and each day he works for eight hours. He has been in this business since 2007.

He started this business in order to earn a living because life was not easy. He has acquired this loan so that he can boost his business output by buying organic manure and pesticides, in that he can be able to harvest a large quantity of high-quality products.

He sells his products to traders from the city and those around. He hopes to be the leading supplier of agricultural products, most especially pineapples. However, he faces the challenge of unpredictable weather changes, especially long droughts which affect the crops. He describes himself as a hardworking man.In the photograph is Joseph with his guarantor(right to left) who also signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 29 years old and a resident of Nabbingo, a suburb of Kampala city. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She went to school up to the level of secondary but due to lack of tuition she dropped out and after that she joined business.

Jackline deals in a clothes business that she started in 2009 with an aim of boosting her daily income and to have a steady home. She got a loan of ugx.1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy more stock to serve her clients better with various clothing designs. 

Jackline sells to people all around and from different towns since her business is strategically located in the busy center. However her main challenge is inadequate capital and at times seasonal changes in market demand.

Jackline is a determined and focused lady who aims at acquiring more money to boost her business so that it attains steady growth and expansion.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baby goats that he will feed and sell.

loans.name: Phenehas

texts.en:
Phenehas is a repeat borrower at the branch. He is married and has five children who are all in school. His major source of income is cattle trading, which he started in 2009. He gives the cattle trade business an average of four hours per day and he also gets income from brick-making, which is his other source of income that he does when he is off from the cattle trade business. The business is located in a rural area of Rwenkurejo-Bugongi sub-county--Sheema District--and his main clients are the local traders in that area. He hopes to give his children a decent education using the profits he gets from the business. Phenehas describes himself as a hardworking man but says the competition he faces sets him back. He will use the loan to buy cattle to sell.
He thanks kiva lenders through Ugafode for the partnership and support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a first time borrower of the institution and is applying for UGX 3,000,000. She is 50 years old and a single lady. She has been engaged in events management since 1990 and sells Chinese furniture she gets from importers in the country.  She supplements the income with a decorating business.  Betty says sale of Chinese furniture is a good venture but she is constrained by small capital that leaves her in a position where she cannot meet her clients' demands.  She therefore applied for the loan to increase her stock as a way of making her shop a one stop furniture shopping centre and increasing sales and gross profits.

Betty’s future plan is to see her business flourish to a point where she can import the products herself which would increase her profits since apparently she buys them expensively, making her profits minimal.

loans.use: To buy furniture to sell

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en:
Gorreti is married with four children and three are in school. She has no additional family members.

She has a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for 5 years and works six days a week.

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal, bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef and serving utensils. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements, and ever increasing prices of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. She aspires to get a permanent business premise.

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.
