loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal, bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef and serving utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Fode

texts.fr:
FODE est âgé de 48 ans et vit avec ses six enfants et ses épouses dans la sous préfecture de KOUROUBA, Région de KOULIKORO.
FODE   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, riz, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DANGASSA, NIANGADINA et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 1 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
FODE  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fode is 48 years old and lives with his six children and wives in the Kourouba sub-prefecture in the Koulikoro region. Fodo did not have the opportunity to go to school and at an early age he developed an interest in income-generating activities, notably the purchase, stocking and sale of cereals.

With a view to satisfying his rapidly growing customer base, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. Having repaid his third loan in full, he is now on his fourth indidividual loan which will be used to buy four tons of cereals (corn, rice, millet and fonio) from peasant producers in Dangassa, Niangadina and the surrounding areas. He will keep the cereals for at least one month. He sells principally on a wholesale basis to a customer base made up of retailers from large towns such as Bamako and Oelessebougou.

Fodo hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000FCFA, which will be used to repay his loan; the balace will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Franklin Evaristo

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar vive el señor Franklin, tiene 43 años de edad, está  soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cinco años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan en la institución para salir adelante.

Don Franklin es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta salir adelante gracias a lo que él sabe, él y su familia tienen un taller de  ebanistería y una mueblería en la cual venden sus obras, ellos elaboran camas, mueble de toda clase y todo lo que se pueda realizar con la madera, además de vender en su local también llevan a entregar a otras ciudades donde venden  a muy buen precio, el negocio lleva más de 50 años el cual viene de generación en generación.

El está repitiendo el crédito ya que así sale adelante, en el ciclo anterior la situación estuvo muy dura pero gracias al crédito que recibió que pudo salir adelante ya que invirtió en materiales para fabricar sus muebles. Con este crédito va a comprar madera, pinturas, clavos, etc. para seguir en su negocio.  

Sus sueños son que el negocio mejore y se mantenga.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity in traditional products (e.g. straw hats known both throughout Ecuador and abroad), the members of communal bank Madres Unidas (meaning 'united mothers') meet every two weeks. Franklin lives in this city. He is 43 years old, single and lives with his parents. He has been a member of the communal bank for five years. He really appreciates the help that this institution has given him in his efforts to get ahead. Franklin is a very hardworking man who is using his knowledge to get ahead in life. He works in his family's woodworking and furniture-making business, where he sells his creations. They make beds, other types of furniture and anything else you can make out of wood. They sell out of their workshop as well as in other cities, where they sell at very good prices. Their business has been around for over 50 years and has been passed down from generation to generation. Franklin decided to take out a new loan similar to the previous one, since it helped him tremendously: he was able to weather a very tough situation precisely because the loan enabled him to invest in supplies to make furniture. This loan will be used to buy wood, paint, nails and other carpentry materials that they need to make their products. His dream is to keep in business and to sell more furniture.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make furniture.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 48 años, está casada con José con quien tiene 04 hijos de 26, 21, 18  y 10 años respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Rosa  consiste en la venta bebidas en su casa, ella gana un buen porcentaje aunque no tiene refrigeradora, compra a diario barras de hielo y en un latón de plástico refrigera su bebidas gasificadas, además tiene algunas cosas mas en venta, entre ellas panecillos y kekes caseros para sus clientes, lleva ya 03 años trabajando en este negocio y lo hace sola ya que su pareja se dedica a otras actividades. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder hacer las actividades en su hogar, tiene buenos clientes y espera tener una tienda en el futuro. Este es su segundo preéstamo 02 con Kiva y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 soles, comprará mas bebidas de diferentes marcas y sabores.
texts.en: Rosa is 48 years old and married to José. They live in a house of their own with their four children, whose ages are 26, 21, 18, and 10. Rosa's business consists in selling drinks at her house. Despite not having a fridge, she makes quite the decent profit. Every day, she buys blocks of ice and puts them in a plastic bucket to cool the soft drinks she sells. She also has a few other things on sale, such as bread rolls and home-made cakes. She has had this business for three years. She manages it alone, since her husband has a job of his own. What Rosa likes about her activity is that it leaves her time to take care of household tasks. She has a loyal customer base and hopes to have a real shop some time in the future. This is her second loan with Kiva: she is very grateful for the opportunity afforded to her to get ahead in life. With the 800 soles she asks for, Rosa will buy more drinks to sell, of various makes and tastes.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a feed silo to store feed for her two cows, who are about to give milk.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 51 years old and lives in Kapan city. She is a very active and bright person. After school, she received a musical education and now she works at the Kapan city theater as an actress. Gayane is married and has two daughters, both of whom are already students. 

Gayane enjoys her work and the time she spends in the theater, but the salary that she receives hardly covers their everyday family needs. Additionally, her elder daughter studies at the Kapan Polytechnic Institute at the Faculty of Economics. 

Gayane asks for a loan of 300,000 AMD in order to pay her elder daughter’s tuition fees. She thanks you in advance and awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay her elder daughter’s tuition fees.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana, age 22, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shop with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Sana needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet her customers' demands. Sana has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items such as oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues. In this way, she will be able to generate a healthier income. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move forward as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar  vive la señora Diana, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija  de 3 años. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Diana además de ser una gran esposa y madre se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren una prenda. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas, ella deja sus productos  a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Compra su mercadería  en Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y ahora le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito, el crédito anterior le quedo ganancias para cumplir como se debía con los pagos y parte de sus ganancias las volvió a invertir en mercadería, así como también para comprar ciertas cosas que necesitaba su bebé, por eso realiza este  crédito para comprar más ropa y seguir adelante en su negocio. Lleva 4 ciclos en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the members of the Madres Unidas Community Bank meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its wide variety of traditional products, including its toquillo straw hats, with are famous both nationally and internationally.

Señora Diana lives here. She is 22, married and has a 3 year old daughter. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

In addition to being a wonderful wife and mother, Diana makes a living selling different kinds of clothing. She is a door-to-door saleswoman, and also sells clothing from her home, where her customers visit her when they want to make a purchase. She works three days a week, mostly in the mornings. She also sells on credit, and collects payment every fifteen days. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to. She began this business with the first loan she received from the bank, and it now allows her to make her own money.

Today, she is taking out another loan. She made a profit from her last loan which enabled her to pay the money back on time, and to invest some of her earnings in merchandise and buy certain things her baby needed. This is why she is requesting this loan, to buy more clothes and succeed with her business. She has been in the community bank for 4 cycles and she likes it because thanks to the first loan she received, she was able to set up her business.

Her dream is to give her daughter the best things in life.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Pamela requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Pamela has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi, de 29 años está casada con Arbildo quien se dedica a la construcción de viviendas. Tienen  de 03 hijos, de 13, 10 y 02 años respectivamente, con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Daysi, consiste en la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azucar, leche, etc. Durante el día, sale a la vereda de su casa y ahí exhibe su producto los cuales compra en el mercado mayorista regional, para luego revenderlas.  Además por las noche vende comida regionales, sale a partir de las 5 de la tarde y empieza a realizar sus comidas, lleva 05 años realizando este trabajo, el cual lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da el espacio suficiente para tener dos ingresos en su hogar, además la cocina siempre fue su pasión . Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y está muy agradecida con el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, entre otros.
texts.en: Daysi is 29 years old and is married to Arbildo, who makes a living building homes. They have three children aged 13, 10 and two, who they live with in their own home. Daysi's work involves selling foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items. During the day, she goes out onto the street in front of the house to exhibit her products, which she buys in the local wholesale market to then sell on. In addition, at night she sells regional dishes. She goes out at 5pm and begins making her food. She has been doing this job for five years, and works alone. What she likes about her work is the fact that it allows her to make two incomes from home, and she has always loved cooking. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the financial help she is given to move forwards. She is also committed to making her loan repayments on time. With the amount of 800 requested, she will buy foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk, beans and other items.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk, beans and other items.

loans.name: Manita De Angel Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado por ocho integrantes todas son mujeres se conocen muy bien entre ellas, su gran amistad es lo que las caracteriza llevan dos ciclos solicitando crédito a VisionFund. Ellas viven en una comunidad mazahua aún conservan sus tradiciones en esta región donde el cultivo más importante es el maíz. De hecho, durante el mes de septiembre, las personas de la región podrán disfrutar finalmente de los elotes después de algunos meses de cultivo.  Los integrantes eligieron el nombre Manita de Ángel porque en la casa de la representante del grupo hay una planta con este nombre. Doña Alicia tiene 39 años de edad está casada desde hace 22 años con el señor Fabián quien es comerciante, juntos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales están estudiando. Doña Alicia se dedica a la venta de fantasía productos como bolitas, aujas, broches, diademas, antenas, hilos, pilas etc., en la actividad lleva ya 22 años. Doña Alicia comento “Empecé vendiendo solo en una charola chica, andaba en las plazas, yo misma tome la iniciativa de iniciar con la venta". Esta vez con el crédito Doña Alicia comprará más mercancía para ella ya que es muy importante tener más productos para ofrecer. Doña Alicia y su esposo tienen dificultad para vender su mercancía ya que en las plazas no les permitían instalarse, pero se esforzaron mucho y lograron obtener un puesto estable en el mercado ambulante. Sin embrago, también salen a vender a otros lugares para abarcar más espacios tener mayores ganancias. La meta de Doña Alicia es poder llegar a tener otro lugar estable, más que nada hacer crecer su negocio sus ganancias serán de gran ayuda para la solventar los gastos de educación de sus niños los cuales tiene muchas ganas de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y mejorar su calidad de vida. Los integrantes del grupo son Ana Elizabeth  y  Janet ellas ocupara su crédito para invertirlo en ropa, Felisa, Celedonia, Josefina y Rosalba lo ocuparan para invertirlo en productos de jarcería e Irene invertirá en borregos y pollos. Ellas están muy agradecidas con KIVA y Vision Fund por el crédito otorgado será de gran ayuda para hacer crecer sus negocios lo cual permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida en cada una de sus familias.
texts.en: This group is made up of eight members. All of them are women who know each other very well. Their great friendship is what distinguishes them. They have been getting loans from VisionFund for two cycles. They live in a Mazahua community and still conserve their regional traditions. The most important crop there is corn. In fact, during the month of September, the people in the area can finally enjoy the ears of corn after several months of cultivation. The members chose the name Manita de Ángel because at the group representative's house there is a plant with that name. Alicia is 39 years old. She has been married for 22 years to Fabián who is a merchant. Together they have created a family with three children who are in school. Alicia sells accessory products such as beads, pins, headbands, antennas, threads, batteries, etc. She has been doing this for 22 years. Alicia remarked “I started selling from a small tray, walking around the plazas. I started the initiative to sell myself."  This time, with the loan, Alicia will buy more merchandise since it is important to have products to offer. Alicia and her husband have difficulty selling their merchandise since they weren't allowed to set up in the plazas. but they worked really hard and were able to get a stable spot in the street market. Nonetheless, they also go out to sell in other places to cover a wider area and have more profit. Alicia's goal is to be able to have another stable spot, more than anything to grow her business. Her earnings will be a big help to pay for her children's education expenses. They really want to be able to go to college and improve their quality of life. The members of the group are Ana Elizabeth and Janet. They are going to use their loans to invest in clothes. Felisa, Celedonia, Josefina and Rosalba will use it to invest in cleaning supplies, and Irene will invest in sheep and chickens. They are very grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund for the loan. It will be a big help to grow their businesses, which will allow them to improve their and their families' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, pins, ribbons, hairbands, hair beads, etc.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old, married to Geoffrey, and has been blessed with four children aged 13,10, 8 and 6 years. She runs a grocery shop and has been in business for 20 years and right now her monthly income is KSH 20,000. 

Gladys is borrowing a loan of 30,000 which she intends to add to her grocery shop. She plans to buy a piece of land with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her first loan from KADET.

loans.use: to add stock to her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 35 years old from the town of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 5, 7 and 9. For five years, she has been engaged in the food vending business where she sells home-cooked meals for her neighbors as well as snacks such as banana cue (deep fried bananas in caramelized sugar), boiled bananas, and pancakes. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, margarine and sugar so that she can continue to produce and sell for a profit. 

Her business helps to contribute to the household expenses when her husband's income from being a construction worker is not enough.

In the future she hopes to expand her business and have an increase in her business profitability so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy sugar, margarine and flour.

loans.name: Jedislenni

texts.es: Jedislenni, a sus 28 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 8 años y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Desde hace siete años comenzó a trabajar en un almacén de ropa para dama desempeñando el cargo de vendedora de mostrador pero, hace pocos meses decidió independizarse y montó su propio negocio que consiste en comercializar blusas para dama diseñadas por ella misma, luego del diseño ella las manda a confeccionar y luego las distribuye a diferentes clientes de la ciudad, todas estas actividades las realiza ella sola, pero en temporadas especiales contrata a otra persona que le colabore debido a que se aumentan los pedidos, especialmente en el segundo semestre del año, lo que le exige tener buen capital de trabajo. La cliente es una mujer activa, emprendedora, creativa y pujante, con el ánimo de seguir avanzando se motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima e insumos (telas, accesorios, hilos, botones) y para pagar a los confeccionistas que le producen sus diseños; esto le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y sacar más producción para satisfacer los requerimientos y necesidades de los clientes que se abastecen para la temporada navideña, todo esto se reflejará en el incremento de su rentabilidad y los ingresos que recibe, con los cuales desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio hasta cumplir el sueño de tener una marca propia, que sea reconocida en el mercado, sacar producción para distribuir al por mayor y generar más oportunidades de empleo; de esta manera Jedislenni podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Jedislenni is 28 years old. She is the mother of one 8 year old son and lives with her romantic partner. Seven years ago, she started working in a women's clothing store as a counter salesperson. A few months ago, she decided to go off on her own and she opened her own business. It consists of selling blouses designed by her. After she designs them she orders them to be made and then distributes them to different customers in the city. She does all of these activities alone, but during special times she hires someone else to help her because the number of orders goes up, especially the second half of the year. This requires her to have good working capital. She is an active, enterprising, creative and driven woman.  In order to keep getting ahead, she is asking for this loan to invest in buying raw materials (fabric, accessories, thread, buttons) and to pay the sewers who make her designs. This allows her to increase her working capital and get more production to satisfy the requirements and needs of the customers who are stocking up for the Christmas season. All of this is reflected in the increase of profitability and income she makes. With them, she wants to keep investing in her business until she attains her dream os having her own brand that is recognized in the marketplace, getting production to distribute wholesale and generate more employment opportunities. This way, Jedislenni will be able to improve her family's quality of life and well being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fabric, accessories, thread, buttons) and to pay the sewers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electric wiring in his house.

loans.name: Anipa

texts.ru: Анипе 42 года. Совместно с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. В 1998 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле сухофруктами, специально закупают фрукты, сушат их и продают, использовали в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Анипа имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли улучшить условия жизни своей семьи. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Анипа обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Анипа планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота.
texts.en:
Anipa is 42 years old. Together with her husband she raises four children. In 1998, the two of them started a business of selling dried fruits, more specifically purchasing fruit, drying and selling them. As staring capital they used a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). After they were able to develop their business and finding returning customers, Anipa was has an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to persistent work with the business, the two of them were able to improve their family's living conditions. With an aim to further develop and expand their business, Anipa turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase turnover of her inventory. Anipa plans to invest the income from the loan increasing working capital.

loans.use: to buy fruits wholesale to dry and sell as dried fruit

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Бактыгул - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыгул занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 20 овец, а также обрабатывает земельный надел размером 2,56 ГА, на которой ежегодно сажают фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на сбор урожая фасоли. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Bakhtygul is 42 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Bakhtygul has specialized secondary education. As the main income for her family, Bakhtygul works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 15 years ago with the purchase of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bakhtygul's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow, 20 sheep. She also processes a plot of land of 2.56 hectares, on which she plants beans every year. The monthly income is 8,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Bakhtygul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to harvest beans. Bakhtygul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save money for educating her children further.

loans.use: to pay the workers for their help in the harvest of beans

loans.name: Sara Isolina

texts.es:
Doña Sara es una señora de 37 años que se dedica a la agricultura con un grado de educación cursado hasta segundo grado de primaria ya que cuando ella estudio sus padres no tenían los recursos y los suficientes centro de educación para poderse educar. Doña Sara es madre de 3 hijos la mayor tiene 17 años y curso hasta el sexto grado de la primaria, el segundo hijo tiene 15 años y también curso el sexto grado y la tercera hija tiene 11 años quien actualmente está cursando el 5 grado de la primaria. Ella se ha dedicado a las labores domésticas en hogares de la misma localidad para traer ingresos a su casa ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos para darle una herencia digna. La tierra que ella en compañía de su esposo trabajan es una herencia que le dejaron a su conyugue el cual es agricultor y con el tiempo ellos siguieron trabajando y adquiriendo más y más tierra para trabajar de manera propia.

Una de sus metas es comprar un carro porque lo necesitan para desarrollar mejor su trabajo y quiere que su negocio crezca para dejarle a sus hijos un patrimonio digno ya que no cuentan con la preparación académica para defenderse en la vida y apoyar a su hija menor para sea una profesional. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de 2 QQ de urea, 2000 unidades de plantilla nueva de café para cultivar, 2 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 2 QQ de fórmula 18-26-0 con lo que aumentara sus cosechas y dará asistencia a las mismas.
texts.en:
Sara, 37, works in agriculture. She studied up to the second grade of primary school; when she was in school, her parents could not continue paying for her education. She has three children. Her daughter, 17, and her son, 15, studied up to the sixth grade of primary school. The third child, an 11-year-old daughter, is now in fifth grade.

Sara has worked as a housekeeper in different houses within the community in order to help her parents with an additional income, since they did not have enough resources to leave her sufficient inheritance. The land she and her husband work was inherited from his parents. With time, they continued to work and acquired more land and became more independent.

One of her goals is to buy a car, since they need it to improve their working conditions. She also wants to expand her business, so that she can leave a good inheritance for her children, who did not receive enough training to be competitive professionally. She also wants to support her youngest daughter so that she can become a professional. She is requesting a loan to buy two quintals of urea [around 200 pounds], 200 coffee plants, two quintals of “12-24-12” [Nitrogen-Phosphorus-Potassium in %] and two quintals of “18-26-0”. With these supplies, she will expand her plantations and will give them maintenance.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and coffee plants.

loans.name: Telma

texts.es:
Doña Telma tiene 43 años de edad curso hasta el quinto grado y por falta de recursos económicos tuvo que retirarse. Su esposo termino la primaria y por los mismos motivos de su esposa tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar y dejar los estudios ellos solo tiene un hijo el cual tiene la edad de 7 años y está en primer grado en una escuela de la comunidad. Con ellos vive el hijo del esposo que fue fruto del primer hogar y que por decisión de ambos está con ellos el llego hasta sexto grado y por los momentos no está estudiando tiene 14 años de edad. La actividad económica de ellos es el cultivo de café por lo que al momento del corte el producto es vendido a las bodegas del municipio en el cual ellos viven siendo ellos los únicos como familia los involucrados en todas y cada una de las actividades que se realizan en el campo. 

Doña Telma tiene como meta y propósito dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café para poder asegurar su cosecha para la próxima temporada y poder vender el grano a un buen precio en el mercado. Con las ganancias ella quiere cumplir con su compromiso, re invertir en sus cultivos y hacer unas mejoras a su casa de habitación las cuales son necesarias para tener una mejor condición de vida. Por lo que ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con lo que comprara 2 QQ de urea, 6590 plantillas nuevas de café para extender sus cultivos, 2 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 2 QQ de fórmula 18-26-0.
texts.en:
Telma is 43 years old and left school after the fifth grade because of a lack of economic resources. His wife finished primary school and for the same reasons as her husband had to leave education and find work. They have just one child aged seven, who studies at a local primary school. Her husband's son from a previous relationship lives with them, a decision taken by both of them. He is 14, and studied until sixth grade, but he isn't studying at the moment.  Their economic activity is coffee growing. Upon being harvested, their product is sold  to local stores. They are the only people in their area to be involved with all of them, and every activity they carry out is in the countryside.

Telma's goal and aim is to maintain and look after her coffee crops, to ensure a good harvest next season and sell the beans for a good price at the market. With her profits, she wants to meet her commitment, reinvest in her crops, and make improvements to her home which are necessary for a better quality of life. This is why she has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative, with which she will buy 2 quintals of urea, 6590 new coffee plants to expand her crop, 2 quintals of 12-24-12 fertilizer and 2 quintals of 18-26-0 fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and agricultural inputs to maintain and look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una señora soltera de 46 años quien tiene dos hijos hombres  quienes viven en Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la producción agrícola desde hace 7 años eligió esta actividad porque le gusta ya que invierte su capital y así obtiene  mejores  ganancias,  por lo que de esta manera aporta a la economía familiar. Realiza una segunda actividad como comerciante en la venta de verduras.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra de semillas de papa y abono orgánico para poder cultivar  y así comercializarlo en el  mercado local  y de esta forma obtener más ingresos y mejores ganancias para sacar adelante a su familia.
Su sueño es construir su casa ya que por el momento vive en 2 cuartos pequeños, esto lo hace con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sabina, 46, is single, has two sons and lives in Sololá.  She has been a crop farmer for seven years and chose this activity because she enjoys it.  It is a way of investing her capital, earn an income and contribute to the household economy.  She also has a business selling vegetables.

She is requesting a loan of 3,500 GTQ to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer so she can cultivate and sell her produce at the local market.  This will increase her income and profits so her family can prosper.

Her goal is to build a house since the one she lives in has two small rooms.  Her aim is to improve the family's lifestle.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ileana Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ileana es maestra de una escuela primaria de Chontales, tiene bajo su custodia un nieto que depende económicamente de ella. El servicio sanitario de su vivienda consiste en una letrina en mal estado ubicada en el patio de la casa. Solicita el financiamiento para pagar la mano de obra de excavación de sumidero y compra de piedras canteras para la construcción de la base de un inodoro. Esta inversión doña Ileana la hará en dos etapas siendo esta la primera. en una segunda fase terminara la construcción e instalación del nuevo inodoro que permitirá mayor seguridad y salud a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Ileana is a teacher at the elementary school in Chontales.  She takes care of her grandson who lives with her and depends on her economically.  The bathroom she has at home is located in the patio and in bad condition.  The loan she is requesting is to hire workers to build a septic tank and to buy stones to build the foundation for a bathroom.

Ileana plans to carry out the investment in two stages and this will be the first one.  The second phase will be the construction and bathroom installation phase, which will give her family more safety and hygiene.

loans.use: To buy stones, cement and sand.

loans.name: Gulafzo

texts.ru: Гулафзо 38 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она более 18 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она шьет национальные женские одежды. Ее дочь помогает ей введению бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему сервису она имеет своих клиентов. Ее сын учится в лицее. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 550 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulafzo is 38 years old. She is married and is raising four children. Her husband is a migrant working in the Russian Federation. She has been providing sewing services for over eighteen years. She sews traditional women's clothing. Her daughter helps her in the business. She has regular customers because of her good service. Her son goes to school. She has to pay for the tuition of her son, but does not have enough money. Gulafzo is asking for a loan in the amount of $550 USD to pay for her son's education. She is waiting for your generosity and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education of her son.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a widow with three school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past two years; she sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Sandra Jessenia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija  de 1 año y 3 meses de edad. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Sandra es una joven madre y  esposa que a más de estar al tanto de su pequeña también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja tres o cuatro  días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas, ella aprovecha que a esas horas su mamá le cuida a su pequeña, deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución ya que esto le permite ganar sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia.

Este  crédito es para comprar ropa para vender a sus clientes. Lleva 3 ciclos en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive con familiares.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Madres Unidas" meets every 15 days in the city of Montecristi, which is known for its great diversity of typical products, such as the local straw hat, known both nationally and internationally.

This is where Sandra, 21, lives.  She is married and has a 15-month-old daughter.  Her husband works in a blanket factory.  Sandra is a young wife and mother who, in addition to caring for her little girl, works selling all kinds of clothing as a door-to-door vendor.  She works three or four mornings  a week which is when her mother is able to take care of the baby.  She sells on a credit basis and collects payment every two weeks.  

Sandra started her business with the first loan she received through the communal bank, so she is very grateful to the institution for helping her earn her own income for the household.  This loan will be used to buy clothing to sell to customers.  Sandra has been a member of the bank for three cycles.  Her goal is to have her own home, since she now lives with relatives.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Rubinsita

texts.en:
Rubinsita is 59-year-old married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rubinsita has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines; she requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried coconut meat to sell. Rubinsita has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Rubinsita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent, and chips

loans.name: Karen Annabel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.
En este lugar vive la señora Karen, tiene 20 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres con sus hermanos menores.

Ella es una jovencita muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar sus propios recursos para mejorar su futuro y también ayudar a sus padres que son de muy bajos recursos económicos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale a recorrer la ciudad casi todos los días y también su mamá le ayuda si alguien llega a su casa y necesita de alguna prenda, deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco con lo cual ella ayuda a sus padres y hermanos que estudian.

Este  crédito es  para comprar ropa de todo tipo para cumplir con sus clientes. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Madres Unidas" meets every 15 days in the city of Montecristi, which is known for its great diversity of typical products such as the local straw hat, famous both nationally and internationally.

This is where Karen, 20, lives.  She is single and lives with her parents and younger siblings.  She is a hard-working young woman who likes to have her own income to improve her future and also help her parents because of their low income.  Karen sells all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis.  She goes out every day.  Her mother also helps with sales when a customer comes to the house in need of an article of clothing.  Sales are made on a credit basis and payment is collected every eight days.  Karen started her business with the first loan she received through the communal bank, so she has been able to help her parents and her siblings who are students.

This loan is to buy all kinds of clothing to meet customer demand.  This is her second loan cycle with the bank.  With the first loan she was able to launch her business.

Her dream is to open a shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has four children; three attend school and one is still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years she has operated a milk selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

Mwanamisi is requesting a loan to purchase more gallons of milk to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of milk to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Teresa de Jesús tiene 44 años de edad con un grado de educación de primaria completo y no pudo continuar estudiando porque sus padres no pudieron apoyarla ya que ella era la mayor de sus hermanos y tenía colaborar con el cuido de los más pequeños. Su esposo solo curso hasta tercer grado y por motivos de apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres el no pudo continuar. Ella se encarga de atender los negocios sobre sus cultivos de café como también un pequeño negocio de pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación con asesoría del esposo ya que él se dedica más al cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Ellos tienen seis hijos quienes viven con ellos el mayor tiene 19 años y está por graduarse como mecánico en un colegio técnico de la comunidad, el segundo tiene 17 años y solo curso plan básico ya que no quiso seguir estudiando y prefirió apoyar en los negocios a sus padres, el tercero tiene 13 años y no está estudiando, el cuarto hijo tiene 10 años está en cuarto grado en una escuela de la comunidad, el quinto hijo tiene 9 años y está en tercer grado y la última tiene 7 años y está en primer grado y está estudiando en la misma escuela que estudian sus hermanos mayores. La tierra que cultivan la adquirieron por herencia las cuales están ubicadas en el mismo terreno donde ellos tienen la casa y habitan. 

Doña Teresa de Jesús sueña con comprar una manzana de tierra para extender más sus cultivos de esa forma dejarles a sus hijos una herencia para que ellos puedan defenderse por sí solos y apoyarles en sus estudios ya que ella no pudo estudiar para que sean personas exitosas en la vida. Por lo que ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 3 QQ de urea, 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 2 sacos de fertilizantes, 3 litros de herbicidas, 3 litros de plaguicida y 11 QQ de café oro los cuales cultivara.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is 44 years old and left education after primary school. She was unable to continue with her studies as her parents couldn't support her. She was also the oldest of her siblings and had to help look after the younger ones. Her husband only studied until the third grade, and then because of the financial problems his parents had, he wasn't able to continue.

Teresa is responsible for looking after her coffee crop business as well as a small grocery store she has at home. She is given advice by her husband, who makes a living growing maize and beans. They have six children who live with them. The eldest is 19 and is about to graduate as a mechanic from a local technical college. The second oldest is 17 and only studied the basic level, because he didn't want to keep studying, preferring to help his parents with their businesses. The third is 13 and isn't studying, and the fourth is 10 and is in the fourth grade in a local school. The fifth is 9 and is in the third grade, and the youngest is 7, is in the first grad,  and is studying in the same school as her older siblings. 

They inherited the land that they farm, which is located in the same place as their home. Teresa de Jesús dreams of buying a plot of land to grow more crops so as to leave her children an inheritance with which they can look after themselves, and to support them in their education, since she was unable to study, so that they are successful in life. This is why he has requested a loan to buy 3 quintals of urea, 3 quintals of 12-24-12 fertilizer, 2 bags of fertilizer, 3 litres of herbicides, 3 litres of pesticide and 11 quintals of raw coffee to grow.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and certified coffee seeds to grow.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Coya en la provincia  de Calca departamento de Cusco.
La socia Alejandrina; la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores ,la socia cría a estos animalitos para engordarlos y luego ser vendidos a sus clientes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socias saca adelante a su familia, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de chicha.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negocio. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, compra y venta de productos (cereales) venta de chicha, venta de granos secos, venta de verduras, artesanía.
La persona que sale en la foto con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank "SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA" which is located in the district of Coya, in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco.  She continues with her business of raising small animals which she sells to customers.  She has been in business for quite some time and enjoys it because of the economic and personal satisfaction she gets from it.  Alejandrina is a responsible person who provides for her family.  She also sells "chicha" (beverage).  She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

The other members of the group raise animals, buy and sell cereals, sell chicha, grain, vegetables and crafts.  The person whose face is covered in the photo no longer belongs to the group.

Alejandrina is grateful for this support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 40 years old and from the town of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with three children who are 10, 14 and 15. 

Maria Teresa’s husband is a driver, while she operates a sari-sari store in her home, selling basic household needs like chips, seasoning, canned goods, toiletries, and noodles.  

She is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, chips, biscuits, seasoning, and toiletries. These are the items that are needed by her customers on a daily basis, and she always runs out of stock for these. She knows that if she has enough inventory, she would be able to increase her income for her family. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store with more merchandise to offer for better sustainability. Her income will be for her children's education and the family's healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, chips, biscuits, seasoning, and toiletries

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar vive la señora Mary, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Mary es maestra en una escuela de la localidad pero para tener ingresos extras también se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende llantas, filtros, aceites, líquidos de frenos y otros repuestos mas de carros y motocicletas, allí también tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres,  mientras ella cumple con sus actividades como maestra uno de sus hijos o su marido le ayudan en su negocio y una vez que llega ella es quien se encarga del negocio, trabaja todos los días y este negocio lo tiene más de 10 años el cual le ha ayudado mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes ya son profesionales. 

Este  crédito es para comprar llantas, aceites, filtros y líquido de frenos que es lo que más se vende. Esta desde el inicio en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han permitido aumentar su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the Madres Unidas Community Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its wide variety of traditional products, such as the toquilla straw hats, which are famous within Ecuador and beyond.

Señora Mary lives here. She is 56, married and has six grown-up and independent children. Her husband is a driver.

Mary is a teacher in a local school, but to make extra money on the side, she works in business. She has a premises in her home in which she sells tyres, oil, brake fluid and other spare car and motorbike parts. She also has a small snack store there. 

While she carries out her activities as a school teacher one of her children or her husband help out in her business. Once she gets back, she takes charge of the business. She works every day and she has had the business for over ten years, which has really helped her to support her children, who are now professionals.

This loan is to buy  tyres, oil, filters and brake fluid, which is what sells the most. She has been a member of the Community Bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans have enabled her to expand her business. 

Her dream is to move forwards sucessfully.

loans.use: to buy tyres, oil, filters and brake fluid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a fence at her home.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three children, one of whom goes to school and the rest have finished. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. Halima dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 14 to 21. Together with her husband, they farm vegetables like squash, beans, carrots, and radishes. They started this business when they got married. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings, and to expand her business.  Any income generated will be used for school fees and food for the family.

In the future, she hopes be successful in sending her children to school, and live an abundant and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan is 32 years old. She lives in Noyemberyan city in the Tavush region. She has a specialty of nurse, but she has never worked. 

Ruzan has been married since 2004, but she has no children. She says her life and happiness are not full, and sometimes even has no meaning. Her desire to have a child is very strong and great, and she believes that one day she will manage to become mother. Ruzan has already taken three loans from Nor Horizon and she was a very responsible client.

This time she has decided to take a loan with Kiva and she asks a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to take some medical examinations and find out if there is any problem that does not allow her to have a child.

loans.use: To take some medical examinations and to find out if there is any problem that does not allow her to have a child

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman; she has three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Riziki has operated a vegetable stall business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz es un hombre soltero de 33 años de edad, vive junto a 4 hijos los cuales son, 2 hombres y 2 mujeres en el Caserío Chuisanto Tomas Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, Sololá.
El es un hombre que lucha por darle una vida mejor a su familia y es por ello que  día a día se esfuerza por trabajar en el campo, cultivando maíz que  es bastante productivo ya que puede sostener a su familia durante un año y lo puede comercializar en el mercado local de su comunidad.
Comenta que gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre él ahora tiene 20 años de experiencia en  este oficio que hasta el momento le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir en los gastos de su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,500.00 para la compra de abono orgánico para el cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias que le ayudaran a darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz is a single man aged 33. He lives with his four children, two girls and two boys, in the hamlet of Chuisanto Tomas, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, Sololá.

He is a man who fights to give his family a better life, and that's why he works hard in the countryside every day, growing maize. It's fairly productive, because he is able to support his family for a year with it and can sell it in the local town market.

He says that thanks to what his father taught him, he now has 20 years of experience in this business, which up until now has generated a good income and profit which help him to contribute to the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan of 2,500.00 quetzales to buy organic compost to grow corn. His dream is to make more money, which will allow him to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic compost to grow corn.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Zosimo y 3 de sus 9 hijos en una casa alquilada desde hace 13 años. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, sus padre le inculcaron los valores desde pequeña, ya que siempre disfrutó de caminar por las pradera. Posee terrenos agrícolas propios, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que se ubican al costado del río, “son muy productivos, obtengo buenos ingresos pues gracias al riego son de buena calidad”, afirma. Las verduras que produce los comercializan a la ciudad de Lima, donde tiene clientes fijos, asimismo cría animales, los cuales le brindan un ingreso adicional, que le ayuda a mantener la economía del hogar de manera permanente. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Sonia, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hard-working 48-year-old woman. She lives with her husband Zosimo and three of her nine children, in a house that the family has rented for 13 years. 

Sonia has been a farmer for the past 20 years. She always enjoyed walking through farm fields, and her parents instilled their values in her when she was very young. Sonia owns her own land, which she manages meticulously as it is next to a river. "The fields are very productive because they're irrigated," she notes, "and I earn a good income from my farm." 

Sonia sells her produce in Lima, where she has regular customers. She also raises animals, which provide additional income to stabilize the family's finances over the long term. This is Sonia's second Kiva loan, and she is grateful for the financial support of lenders, which has helped to improve her business. Sonia is therefore determined to make timely payments. She will use the 1,000 soles to purchase organic fertilizer to use for her next plantings.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 22 años es una señorita responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá y sus hermanos en una casa alquilada desde hace 10 años. Hace algunos años, tuvo la idea de abrir un salón de belleza en sociedad con su mamá, pues siempre quiso tener un negocio propio que le brinde las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su familia. Desde adolescente trabajó en ventas y servicios, por lo que tuvo la idea de aplicar su conocimiento en lo que más sabe. Su peluquería se ubica en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, por lo que tiene buena acogida, la principal dificultad es el espacio pues es muy pequeño, tiene planeado ahorrar lo necesario para alquilar un local amplio donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Rocío, invertirá los S en /.1500 soles en la compra de peines, cosméticos y demás insumos para su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Rocío is a trustworthy 22-year-old woman. She lives with her mother and siblings in a home that the family has rented for the past ten years. A few years ago, Rocío decided to open a beauty salon with her mother. She'd always wanted to have her own business to provide her with the income her family needed. 

Rocío has worked in sales and service since she was a teenager, so she thought of using her knowledge in her area of expertise. Rocío's hair salon is located  in the city center and is very cozy, but Rocío's main problem is that the salon is small. She therefore plans to save the money she'll need to rent a larger space where she can offer her customers better service. This is Rocío's second Kiva loan, and she's grateful for the support of lenders, which has improved her business. Rocío is determined to make timely payments. She will spend the 1,500 soles on the purchase of combs, cosmetics, and other supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase combs, cosmetics, and other supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jarkynay

texts.ru: Жаркынай 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Жаркынай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жаркынай занимается полеводством и садоводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с 5,000 сом KGS.  Благодаря упорному труду Жаркынай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: абрикосовый сад, а также выращивает грецкие орехи, на поле выращивает картофель, помидоры, перец, капусту. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях развития животноводства, как дополнительного дохода, Жаркынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует в будущем построить мини-ферму.
texts.en:
Jarkynay is 34 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Jarkynay has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Jarkynay works with agriculture and horticulture, after having started 15 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Jarkynay's persistent work, her farm currently has an apricot garden and she also grows walnuts. She also grows potatoes, tomatoes, peppers and cabbage on the land. The monthly income from the loan is 15,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to develop the livestock breeding, as additional income, Jarkynay turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a dairy cow with offspring to increase the number of livestock. Jarkynay plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and plans to build a mini-farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow and calf

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida, de 25 años es una mujer tímida, vive en compañía de su esposo Helder, con quien tiene 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que su tía. Mientras ella se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de animales como toros, ovejas y cerdos, comenta que gracias a ello pueden solventar los gastos diarios del hogar como alimentación y educación. Al inicio fue muy difícil empezar a generar ingresos pues no tenían el capital necesario, pero con mucho esfuerzo y paciencia juntaron un capital fijo. Ahora espera poder mejorar sus sembríos de papa, maíz y demás productos que cultiva en terrenos arrendados y en sociedad con otros agricultores, pues todavía no cuenta con unos propios. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Nerida, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos y también la alfalfa que le ayuda en la alimentación de sus animales.
texts.en: Nerida is 25 years old and shy.  She lives with her husband, Helder,  with whom she has four children to look after, in her aunt's house.  While Nerida makes a living looking after farmland, her husband's job is buying and selling animals such as bulls, sheep, and pigs.  Nerida tells us that, thanks to this work, the couple are able to cover daily household costs, such as food and the children's school costs.  In the beginning it was very difficult to start to earn an income because the couple did not have the necessary capital.  Nevertheless, with a lot of effort and patience, the couple saved up the money.  Now, Nerida is hoping to be able to improve her potato, corn and other crops, which she grows on rented land, in a business with other farmers.  Nerida still does not have her own land.  This is Nerida's first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support being provided as it helps her to improve her business.  Nerida promises to be punctual with her repayments.  Nerida will invest the 500 Nuevo Soles in buying organic manure to nourish her seeds.  She will also buy alfalfa to help feed the animals.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa, de 52 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. El pueblo donde vive se ubica en una zona muy alejada, comenta que gracias a ello puede dedicar mayor tiempo a la agricultura con la siembra de diversos productos de primera necesidad como papa, maíz y demás. Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia hoy posee sus propios terrenos agrícolas, los cuales le otorgan en cada temporada de cosecha buenas utilidades por lo que tiene un capital de trabajo fijo. Ella gusta mucho de levantarse muy temprano para poder cuidar de sus cultivos, mientras alimenta a sus animales que también son una fuente de ingreso constante. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Justa, invertirá los S/.600 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Justa is 52 years old and a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband and children in the house that she inherited from her parents.  Justa lives in a town that is in a very isolated area.  She tells us that, thanks to this, she is able to spend most of her time farming, sowing various basic products such as potatoes, corn, and more. Justa says that, thanks to her effort and perseverance, she now has her own land which, every season, gives her profitable harvests and working capital. Justa likes to wake up very early in order to tend to her crops and to feed her animals, which also provide a constant source of income.  This is Justa's first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support being provided as it helps her to improve her business.  She promises to be punctual with her repayments.  Justa will invest the 600 Nuevo Soles in buying organic manure in order to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta, de 49 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 4 hijos en la casa de su padre. Hace 4 años enviudó, es así que tomo la rienda de su familia y sus hijos a los que quiere mucho. Es trabajadora estable en un colegio del estado de su localidad, donde labora todos los días. Su principal ingreso económico lo obtiene del salario que recibe mensual, el  que está destinado a los estudios superiores de su hijo, quien estudia en la capital, “deseo darle lo mejor”, afirma. Pero como tiene muchas responsabilidades económicas, tuvo la idea de vender comida en el pueblo donde trabaja, en una carpa que se ubica estratégicamente en la escuela donde trabaja, ya que es conocida, pues tiene 23 años laborando. Le va muy bien en su negocio y gracias a sus ganancias puede tener un ingreso extra. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marta, invertirá los S/.1300 en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en: Marta is 49 years old and hard-working.  She lives with two of her four children in her father's house.  Marta became a widow four years ago and so become head of the family.  Her children love her very much.  Marta has a stable job in a local state school, where she works every day and her main income comes from her monthly salary.  She uses this salary to pay for her son's further education studies - he is studying in Lima and, Marta says, she "wants to give him the best" she can.  However, with many bills to pay, Marta had the idea of starting to sell meals in the town where she works.  She works out of a tent which is strategically placed in the school where she works.  Marta is well-known as she has been working there for 23 years. Marta's business is going very well and, thanks to her profits, she has an extra income.  This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support being provided, as it helps her to improve her business.  For this reason, she promises to make her repayments on time.  Marta will invest the 1300 Nuevo Soles in buying supplies to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make meals.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 48 лет, вдова, имеет 2 сыновей. Дети взрослые, работают на частных стройках, проживают вместе с матерью и и помогают по хозяйству. Основным источником дохода является-животноводство, которым Гулнара занимается на протяжении многих лет, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 сом KGS. Гулнара трудолюбивая, благодаря ее трудолюбию, ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря ее упорству она достигла хороших результатов и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова с приплодом. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Гулнара обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 25,000 сом(KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, а также в будущем намерена женить старшего сына.
texts.en: Gulnara is 48, widowed, and has two sons. Her children are grown and work at private constructions sites. They live with their mother and help with the farm. Her main source of income is animal husbandry, which Gulnara has been involved in for many years. She started the business with 1000 som (KGS). Gulnara's industriousness has enabled her monthly income to reach 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her efforts, she has been successful. Currently her farm has 1 dairy cow with a calf. With the goal of increasing her number of animals, Gulnara applied for a loan at the Bai Tushum & Partners microloan bank in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. Gulnara plans to put the income earned from the loan into increasing her number of animals, and she hopes to marry off her older son in the future as well.

loans.use: to buy cow

loans.name: Warni

texts.en:
The story of Saeful, son of Warni:

I’m a first grader in vocational school now.  However, it seems to me that my study there becomes another burden for my parents.  I truly respect them for their hard work and countless effort of supporting me so I can continue my study, but it looks like our condition won’t turn for the better. I don’t want to give them any more trouble, but I feel powerless if it comes to the matter of funding. I hope by joining this program I’ll be able to lighten their burden.

In the picture, Warni and Saeful, her son, and his little brother.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Yatimah

texts.en:
The story of Arif, son of Yatimah:

My family is far from the word “prosper.”  With my father’s job as a laborer, it’s already been hard for us to fulfill our daily needs.  It was going even more difficult by the time I decided to continue studying in vocational school.  I almost lost my hope and came to a decision to quit school.  Of course, that’s not the way I want it to be.  

By joining Kiva, I hope I can keep on going to school, so one day I can graduate, get a better job, and help my family.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with six children. Two of them attend school; the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house consumables.

For over one year, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Mwanalima dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Азам с детства мечтал стать бухгалтером, поэтому после окончания средней школы, он поступил в Институт. Данное время он учиться на 2-ом курсе. Мать Азама много лет болела желудочным кишечным раком.  Врачи делали все возможное, но все оказалось безрезультатным и здоровье матери, становилась все хуже и хуже. На лечение матери пришлось продать машину и несколько голов скота. Год назад мать Азама  скончалась, она всегда мечтала, чтобы ее сын получил высшая образование. Азам очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный сейчас он нуждается в займе для оплаты договора за обучение. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Azam has dreamed of being an accountant since his childhood, so since he finished school, he enrolled in college. He is currently in his second year.

For a long time, Azam's mother has been sick with gastrointestinal cancer. The doctors did everything they could, but it proved ineffective and his mother's health got worse and worse. To pay for his mother's treatments, he had to sell his car and several cattle. His mother died one year ago. She always wished that her son could receive a higher education. 

Azam is very hard-working and dedicated, and now needs a loan to pay for his education. He awaits your generosity and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 40 years old, and she lives in Ijevan City. She is married, and she has three sons. Her eldest son is married and lives separately.  The second son serves at the army, and the smallest son is still school aged. 

Susanna’s husband is in the Russian Federation working abroad. It is already ten years that Susanna has been working as a scrubwoman at a small hotel in Ijevan City.  At the same time, Susanna takes care of a disabled woman in her house. For this work she is, of course, paid.  So all the time, she is doing her best just to earn enough money, since her husband’s support from abroad is not enough for her family needs.

Susanna asks for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams.  She wants to buy a cheap, small car for her everyday use, because in the district where she lives, public transport does not work.

loans.use: to buy a cheap, small car for her everyday use because in the district where she lives, public transport does not work.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi is married and has five children. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rental bills.

For the past eight years, she has operated a greengrocery shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other greengroceries. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past two years, he has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He mentioned fluctuation in prices as his major challenge. Benjamin dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 44-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 8 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be credible. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for selling. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a profitable place, and her primary customers are local residents and business people.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of animal-feed prices, which reduces her profits. She will use the 70,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy animal feeds and a heifer. Her business goal is to be a leading milk trader in the area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 20,000, 40,000 and 80,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and a heifer.

loans.name: Turiman

texts.en:
The story of Nur, son of Turiman:

I came from an unpretentious family.  My parents work as farmers who go to the rice field every day.  It’s been a trouble for my parents to fund my school. My younger sibling studies in second grade of junior high school.  I am a first grader in a vocational school now.  

My house is far from the school.  It takes about one hour to get there.  The funds we need are getting higher and higher.  I want to stop being a burden for my parents, but I don’t want to quit my school either.  I hope there will be a way for me to keep on studying by joining this program.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Maryati

texts.en:
The story of Wawan, son of Maryati:

I am the oldest child of four children.  My father is a pedicab (tricycle) rider with no stable income and far from the word “prosper.”  My mother who has no special skill, can’t give much help to our condition.  My father still has to take care of my three younger siblings who are studying in elementary school.  

Honestly, I don’t want to give them any more trouble by entering vocational school.  However, I want to keep on studying so I can be of much help someday.  I hope by joining this program there will be a solution for my problem. 

In the picture, Maryati, Wawan, her son, and a little sister of Wawan.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Tanaiwa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Rosina from Masvingo. She is single with no children. Rosina is a member of Tanaiwa Group. She also cares for five dependents. Rosina runs an agri-business selling tomatoes, beans and vegetables. The business has been in operation for 20 years. She says the main challenges faced are of perishable products going bad when demand is low and that of high transport costs from the farms to the market stall.
