Rosina has requested a loan of $600 to buy beans, tomatoes and vegetables for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future Rosina plans to open a vegetable shop at Mucheke Rank.

loans.use: to buy beans, tomatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and married. She has nine children and one is still in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alicia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bintimohamed

texts.en:
Bintimohamed is married and has four children. Three are in school and the other is still underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains and garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman. She has three school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Jumwa has operated a vegetable-stall business for the last two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, age 27, is married with two children. She lives in Georgia’s legislative capital, Kutaisi. 

Ana’s spouse works as a distributor for a private company and gets a monthly wage. Ana is a cosmetician and serves women from her house. She has many loyal clients and offers a wide variety of beauty services. Her business is going well, and this is the reason why Ana decided to develop it and start up a cosmetology room in her city. 

With the received startup loan, Ana will purchase all the needed equipment and cosmetic products to serve the clients and satisfy their needs. She hopes to attract more customers, as she’s quite skillful in this field.

Ana hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to start a cosmetology room.

loans.name: Shushik

texts.en:
Shushik is a nice lady and a mother of two children; her son is 17 years old and her daughter is 16 years old. They live in the city of Stepanavan, which is in the Lori region. Shushik’s husband now is working in the Russian Federation and she alone manages both to take care of their children and work as a computer operator. Shushik has graduated Vanadzor State University, Finances and Government Department. Shushik also from time to time conducts accountancy of different companies.
 
Shushik asks a loan of 650,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some accessories connected with it, such as tables and chairs, since she thinks to organize paid courses of accountancy.

loans.use: To buy computer, tables and chairs to organize paid courses of accountancy.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a 40-year-old woman from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She is married and has three children, ages 2, 17 and 18. 

Raquel has been engaged in selling clothes in her neighborhood for one year now. Her clothes are from GTY company, which has become a famous business for housewives in the Philippines.

She is asking for a loan to to buy more clothing to sell. She works hard and knows that she can improve her sales if she has a better supply of trendy clothes.

Her profit will be for her children's needs. In the future, she hopes to make a success of her business so she can continue to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ushuhuda Group

texts.en:
Lukambo is 53 years old, and she is the president of the “Ushuhuda” group. A mother of five children, the client sells various products in the public market. Her husband works in public service as an official. 

This new loan will allow her to run her business. Therefore, she will buy rice, vegetable oil, lotion, shoes, soap, books, pens, sugar, salt, clothes, etc., in order to sustain her business. The benefits will help in sending her children to school and in building her house. Nevertheless, she faces different problems such as high taxes, police hassles, etc. The client would like to thank Hekima for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetable oil, lotion, shoes, soap, books, pens, sugar, salt, clothes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Amerie Zacharie

texts.fr: Amerie est un jeune camerounais de 29 ans. père d'un enfant de 03 ans, il vend des chaussures dans un marché de la ville depuis près de 08 ans.faisant face à une clientèle sans cesse grandissante et exigeante, il souhaite avec l'argent du crédit acheter les sacs de chaussures. les bénéfices  obtenus seront réinjectés dans l'activités et lui permettront dans l'avenir d’acquérir une boutique et d'assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Amerie is a young Cameroonian of 29 years. He is the father of a 3-year-old child, and has been selling shoes in a market in the city for nearly 8 years. In order to serve a customer base that is continually growing and demanding, he hopes to use the loan proceeds to purchase bags of shoes. The profits earned will be reinvested in his business and will allow him to open a shop in the future and to ensure the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1964 à KOUROUBA, KADIATOU vit avec ses cinq  enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire  dans la commune de  Ouelessebougou ville. 
KADIATOU n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait le commerce de légumes. KADIATOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir le commerce de légumes,  de produits alimentaires, etc.    
KADIATOU est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs d’attièkè, quelques sacs de légumes. Elle s’approvisionne avec les  grossistes de SIKASSO  et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle mixte. 
KADIATOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Kourouba, Kadiatou lives with her five children and her husband in a nuclear family in the community of Ouelessebougou. Kadiatou did not have the opportunity to finish school. Early on, she became interested in business thanks to her older sister who was in the vegetable business. Kadiatou, after a few years of experience with her sister, decided to follow in the same line of business of vegetables, food products, etc.

Kadiatou is on her first loan with Soro Yirwaso which she will use to purchase 20 bags of attièkè (a side dish made of cassava) and a few bags of vegetables. She stocks up from the wholesalers in Sikasso and sells her products for cash and credit, at retail and from her home and in the surrounding markets to a customer base made up of both men and women. 

Kadiatou hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which she will use to help her husband to provide for the needs of their family, pay back the loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food.

For over two years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a 43-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and three sons in a small village of Kobuleti district. His wife is housekeeper. One of his sons is provided with an invalidity pension from the government institutions. It is for a total of 70 Laris per month, which is for the medicines. 

Roman works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize, nut trees and mandarin trees. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. Roman has a higher level of education, but in the region there is a high unemployment rate, so self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. 

Roman decided to start a trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. Roman received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo – Start-up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of 3,000 GEL he will purchase cement to resell at a higher price. There is high demand for cement in his region and he hopes that the business will be profitable. The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. With the increased income Roman will be able to improve the living conditions for his sons.

loans.use: to begin trading cement.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 32 years old and lives in Duero, Bohol. She is married with four children aged seven to 19. It is not easy for Sharon to look after her children and her business while her husband is working abroad for their future.

She keeps herself occupied by raising hogs and farming vegetables like spring onions. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets, supplements, fertilizer and seeds. She is looking forward to the day that she can have enough savings and a bigger business that will allow her husband to work at home and be with them. 

Her income helps in paying for school fees and the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, supplement,s fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 60 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo, pues ya todos sus hijos son independientes. Ellos viven solo en la casa que construyeron hace 40 años. Los terrenos que posee se encuentran en la alturas del valle, donde todos los días desde las primeras horas, sale a cultiva, fertilizar y limpiar, ya que depende mucho de ello el éxito de su cosecha. Ella tiene 38 años de experiencia en la agricultura, gracias a su trabajo constante pudo mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, “eso es mi orgullo”, afirma. Ahora se encuentra sembrando en mínima escala, pues desea seguir trabajando en el campo, su mayor pasión. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Alicia, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 60, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband; all of her children are independent.  They live alone in the house that they built 40 years ago.  The land that they have is in the highlands of the valley.  She goes there every day at the first hours to cultivate, fertilize, and clear the fields.  She depends a great deal on the success of the harvest.

She has 38 years of experience in farming.  Thanks to her constant work, she was able to support her children and get them ahead.  “This is what I am proud of,” she affirms.  She is now planting on a small scale.  She wishes to continue working in the field, which is her greatest passion.

This is her second loan with Kiva.  She appreciates the financial support that was given because it helps her to improve her business.  It is for this reason that she pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Alicia will use the 1,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to spread among her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 51 years old and is from the town of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. He is married with two children aged 18 and 22. Raymundo grows green beans - locally known as Baguio beans. His business has existed for 22 years now. 

He is asking for a loan to buy to buy sprayer, fertilizer and seeds for his farm. His profit helps in sending his children to school. In the future, he hopes to have a better income from his farming and expand the land under cultivation so as to get a better profit.

loans.use: to buy sprayer, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 42-year-old man from the community of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. He has two children ages 15 and 18. He has supported his family by farming vegetables like string beans for 18 years now. Samuel barely earns an average income of 4,000 PHP every month for his family. 

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his vegetables. A loan will be a great help for his business as he also needs to wait for a few months before his harvest time. 

In the future, Samuel dreams of a bigger business for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 39-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from six to 10 years. He describes himself as a go-getter. He operates a retail store where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a suitable area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low prices. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add to his stock of bread for resale. His business goal is to be the main supplier of bread in the area he lives in within five years.

loans.use: to add a stock of bread for resale.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 27-year-old married woman. She has a child who is 9 years old. She describes herself as aggressive. She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, flour, drinks and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located by a road side and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transport. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour. Her business goal is to open another shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a stock of maize, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha, de 51 años es una mujer feliz, pues vive junto a su esposo Alipio, con quien tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo vive con una de ellas en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Desde hace 8 años emprendió el negocio de venta de comestibles en la parte delantera de su casa, comenta que desde entonces le fue muy bien, pues fue la primera en vender alimentos en el pueblo, que se encuentra alejado de la ciudad. Es así que ahora espera poder aumentar de más productos alimenticios, variados y nutritivos, ya que es una de las pobladoras más reconocidas por su carisma y la buena atención. Comenta que además de la tienda de comestibles también gusta de sembrar y criar animales como una buena hija del campo, pero estas actividades lo realiza de manera ocasional. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Bertha, invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de comestibles como arroz, leche,azúcar, entre otros, para abastecer su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Bertha, age 51, is a happy woman because she lives with her husband, Alipio.  They have four children.  Only one of the children lives with her in the house that she inherited from her parents.  Eight years ago she undertook the business of selling groceries in the front part of her house.  She comments that ever since then it has gone very well.  She was the first one to sell food in her village, which is far from the city.

She now hopes to be able to increase her varied and nutritious food products.  She is one of the most well-known villagers because of her charisma and good service.  She comments that in addition to her food store, she also like to plant and raise animals as a good daughter of the countryside.  However, she does these business activities occasionally.  

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support provided; it helps her to improve her business.  For this reason she pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Bertha will use the 300 soles to buy groceries like rice, milk, and sugar, among others, to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy groceries like rice, milk, and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 32-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages seven and ten years. She describes herself to be credible. 

Jacinta operates a cereals shop where she sells maize, beans, and peas. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a profitable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be availability of capital to buy additional stock and expand her business. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy stocks of maize and beans for her business. Her business goal is to grow and open a big cereals store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be self-reliant. 

This is Jacinta's third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Previous loans of KES 20,000 and KES 50,000 were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy stocks of maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a widow with six children, four of whom are school-going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyevu has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from her home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 32-year-old woman from the town of Garcia-Hernandez. She is married with three boys ages one, seven, and nine. Catherine is engaged in a sari-sari store (small food store) business and needs windows made of aluminum and glass. Her second business started a year ago and helps bring additional income to her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy glass, aluminum, and payment for labor during production of the windows. Her income provides for the basic needs of her family.

In the future, she would like to continue to expand and improve her business for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy glass, aluminum, and payment for labor

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is married with three children, two of whom attend school and one who is underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a restaurant business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en:
Elphas is a 43-year-old married man. He has two children, ages three years and six years. 

He describes himself to be determined and focused. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones and gravel. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area which attracts estate developers who are his primary customers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads to the site of the quarry. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more building stones for resale. His business goal is to acquire a large field of quarry within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will sustain himself economically. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 40,000 and 20,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more building stones for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with one child who goes to school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Beatrice has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. 

With the KSH 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old single woman. She has 2 children, aged 14 years and 17 years old. She describes herself as "determined". Mary operates a shoes stall where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area favorable for business and her primary customers are of all types.
She describes her biggest business challenge to be the inflation of prices. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of shoes for resale. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of shoes within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land and put up rental houses.

loans.use: to add stock of shoes for resale

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married and has four children, one who is underage, two who are at school, and one adult. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a green grocery shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green groceries. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
This is Monica. She previously accessed a loan that she used to buy cereals, potatoes, bananas and tomatoes for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures. 
Monica would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy onions, tomatoes and vegetables for her business. The profit from her business will definitely help to provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy cereals, potatoes, bananas and tomatoes

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a married woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. For the past five years, Hannah has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as being her major challenge. Hannah dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is a married woman and a mother of two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Salima operates a dumpling selling business for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Ransom

texts.en: Ransom is single and lives in Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor. Ransom engages in hog raising to earn a living. He has had this business for 11 years. Each month he earns 7,500 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional piglets and feed. Ransom is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Ransom hopes to expand his business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mabinty from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 10 years and 18 years. In 2000, Mabinty established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income. She works at this business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.
Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mabinty plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Memunatu from Waterloo, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with one child who is 5 years old.  In 2011, Memunatu established her medical drugs business. She began her business because she wanted to create her own source of income to contribute to taking care of her family.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of medical drugs to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Memunatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of medical drugs to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 17 years and 25 years.  

In 2000, Kadiatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of one year and four years.  

She began her business because she wants to create her own source of income, instead of depending on her husband. In 2008, Fatmata established her general store business. She works at the business from 8 am to 12 pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Fatmata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, juice, and pure water.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is 54 years old and lives in Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor. He is married with five children who are adult or school-age. 

Luis is engaged in selling fish to earn a living, and he has had this business for 30 years. Each month, he earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 that he will use in purchasing additional fishing equipment.

Luis is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Luis hopes to expand his business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Evelin

texts.en:
Evelin is single, 47 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor. Evelin sells variety of products to earn a living and had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to be used to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, beverages and soft drinks. Evelin has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Evelin hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 43 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with three children. Mila has a coco lumber business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to buy additional lumber tools such as a woodchuck timber jack tool, a measuring tool, a tweaker lumber leverage tool, a chainsaw mill,etc.

Mila has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Mila hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional lumber tools such as a woodchuck timber jack tool, a measuring tool, a tweaker lumber leverage tool and a chainsaw mill.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of five years and 18 years. She runs a retails business in the Waterloo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to help her earn a daily living. 

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells brooms within a busy market area. She says that at present, her business is doing well because she is able to use the profit to support her family.

Eliza requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy purchase beans and brooms for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and roof her house for during the rainy season. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase beans and brooms for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of five years and 10 years.  

In 2000, Isatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to improve the lives of her family. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil and native rice to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil and native rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 35 years old and lives in Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor. She is separated with two children who are in school and are infants. Adelaida is engaged in a fish-vending activity to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 9,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to be used to purchase additional fishing equipment and fish to sell. Adelaida is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Adelaida hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment and fish to sell.

loans.name: Blessie

texts.en:
Blessie is 41 years old and lives in Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor. She is married with four children who are school-aged. Blessie is engaged in a fish-vending activity to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to be used to purchase additional fishing equipment and fish to sell. Blessie is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Blessie hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment and fish to sell.

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Yanjmaa, 44 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She has been teaching music to students in high school since 2009. Her husband works as a sentry at school. 
Their two children go to high school. 

Mrs. Yanjmaa is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase fiberglass, foam and hardwood floors. Using those materials, she wants to make renovations to her ger in preparation for the upcoming winter. As a result, the ger will stop losing its heat through its walls and floor, and her family will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fiberglass, foam and hardwood floor to renovate her dwelling in preparation for the upcoming winter.

loans.name: Jiadema

texts.en:
Jiadema, a 49-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a general store in the Philippines for 20 years 

The recipient of previous Kiva loans, Jiadema has requested a new one for PHP 28000 to purchase more items such as biscuits, soft-drinks, bread, etc.  Jiadema aspires to save money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, soft-drinks, bread and other groceries.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 52 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Marites has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Marites aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 41-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte, industriously caring for her dried fish activities. She is married and has three children. She personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. The business is doing well. Alma has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now Alma sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 5,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional fish. She deeply wishes for a good education for her kids and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to have additional capital to buy fish.

location.town: SINDANGAN-MANIL, LEON B. POSTIGO, ZAMBOANGA DEL NO

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a father of two children, wants to provide for their needs. A businessman who earns from various ventures, he operates an eatery and a boarding house business, both of which feed his family. 

Joseph is now requesting his second loan with PMPC for Php 50,000 to purchase raw ingredients for his eatery. He wants to expand into catering and wishes to maintain his good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for his eatery business

loans.name: Diadema

texts.en:
Diadema is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Diadema is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Diadema has been farming vegetables for ten years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jorelyn

texts.en:
Jorelyn is 42 years old and married with two children.

Jorelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jorelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and earns an additional income from raising pigs.

Jorelyn aspires to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married, with three children. She is 48 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Gemma operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and she has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000 for additional capital for her store.

Gemma is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in Basirang, Tudela, Philippines.

Marife sells personal care products to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30,000 to purchase additional personal care products such as lip balms, cleansing pads, colognes, skin moisturizers, perfumes, lipsticks, facial powders, etc.

Marife has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marife hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal care products such as lip balms, cleansing pads, colognes, skin moisturizers, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Delilah has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Delilah requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell.

Delilah has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Delilah would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of personal products  to sell.

loans.name: Haouwa Mamadou

texts.fr: Madame Hawa est une brave femme âgée de 48ans qui évolue dans la vente de bétail de plus de 5ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui ont entre 22ans et 18ans. Au début elle vendait du lait caillé pour subvenir aux charges familiales et scolaires. Maintenant elle a besoin de crédit pour acheter plus de bétail et les revendre. Ainsi elle pourra aider son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et augmenter ses revenus afin d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour revenir à la maison à 19h. A l'avenir elle souhaite ouvrir une ferme d'élevage et être pérenne pour ne plus avoir besoin de crédits.
texts.en: Ms. Hawa is a good and honest woman, 48 years old, who has been selling animals for over five years. She is a married mother of four children, from 18 to 22 years old. At first, she used to sell milk curds to help with family expenses and schooling costs. Today, she needs a loan to purchase more animals to resell. Thus, she will be able to help her husband to manage day-to-day expenses and to augment her income, so as to improve her family's living conditions. She starts her day at 8 AM and finishes at 7 PM. For the future, she would like to start a livestock farm and to be sustainable in order not to have need of loans anymore.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to resell

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Coumba est une habituée du Guichet, bien qu'habitant à quelques kilomètres elle y vient souvent pour épargner. C'est une brave femme âgée de 41ans qui est mariée et mère de 06 enfants âgés de 04 à 18ans. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Coumba commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h, elle évolue dans la vente de bétails et ceci depuis plus de 5ans.Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son cheptel et satisfaire la demande de forte de ses clients. Coumba souhaite ouvrir une ferme d'élevage pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle dit un grand merci à l'IMCEC.
texts.en: Ms. Coumba is a regular client at this branch office. Even though she lives some kilometers away, she often comes to deposit savings. This good and honest woman is 41 years old, married, and the mother of six children, from 4 to 18 years old. She helps her husband to manage day-to-day expenses and her children's schooling costs. Coumba starts her day at 8 AM and finishes at 6 PM. She sells animals and has been working at it for over five years. She is requesting this loan to increase her herd and satisfy the strong customer demand. Coumba would like to start a livestock farm in order to augment her income and to improve her family's living conditions. She says she is very thankful to IMCEC.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to resell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar con la agricultura y por la buena atención que le brinda la Institución; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
Con el crédito anterior comenta el Sr. Concepción que le ayudo a adquirir los materiales agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Su sueño es apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios y que no le falta la alimentación, asimismo mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Concepcion needs to get a new loan for working capital in order to continue farming and also for the good support he gets from the loan institution. This loan will help him buy agricultural supplies like manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, pest-control products, etc. 

Concepcion says that the previous loans helped him get agricultural products to grow corn and beans. His dream is to support his son in his studies and make sure he doesn’t go hungry as well as improve their home.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, pest-control products, etc.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: John Antonio

texts.es: John, a sus 49 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a desempeñarse como cerrajero, actividad que aprendió de su padre cuando era joven. Actualmente tiene un taller de cerrajería ubicado en un local arrendado, allí fabrica puertas, rejas, ventanas, artículos en hierro forjado y todo los productos que sus clientes le soliciten, de esa manera ha logrado generar los recursos económicos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia. El cliente es un hombre trabajador, humilde, pujante y perseverante, siempre busca opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando, razón por la cual se motiva a solicitar el crédito, pues desea mejorar su capacidad instalada comprando una máquina dobladora de lámina, con la cual podrá agilizar su producción y reducir costos de fabricación, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento del margen de utilidad que se genera por la venta de los productos. Esto le permitirá a John seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, hacerlo más rentable y le dará la oportunidad de avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo, que es adquirir un local propio para tener su taller y así seguir trabajando con esmero y dedicación para brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y bienestar, y en un futuro a mediano plazo, disfrutar al lado de su familia los frutos de su ardua labor.
texts.en:
John at 49 years old lives with his wife and four children. He has worked all his productive life as a locksmith which his father taught him when he was young. Today he has a shop in a rented space where he makes doors, iron grates, windows, wrought iron goods, and other products that clients request. Doing this he generates enough money to get his family ahead. 

John is a hard-working, modest, vigorous and persevering person who is always looking for ways to grow. For this reason he is requesting a loan because he wants to increase his production capacity by buying a metal bending machine.This will speed up his production and reduce the cost of fabrication. Which will show up in an increase in the profit margin in selling his products.

This will allow John to continue strengthening his business, making it more profitable and give him the opportunity to move towards his main goal. Which is to acquire a place of his own to have his shop.He wants to continue working diligently and with dedication so he can offer his children a better education and well-being. In a medium term future he'd like to enjoy the fruits of his labor alongside his family.

loans.use: to buy a metal bending machine.

loans.name: Mamoudou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamoudou est un homme âgé de 29ans qui est célibataire sans enfant et évolue dans la couture. Il a une expérience de 14ans dans cet activité. Mamoudou aide sa famille dans les charges quotidiennes de la maison. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 22h. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter une machine à coudre pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle. A l'avenir Mamoudou voudrait ouvrir une mercerie pour augmenter sa productivité et améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Mamoudou is a 29-year-old man who is unmarried and without children. He works in the tailoring trades. He has fourteen years of experience in this business. Mamoudou helps his family to cover day-to-day household expenses. His day starts at 8 AM and finishes at 10 PM. He is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine to satisfy the needs of his customers. For the future, Mamoudou would like to open a sewing supplies shop to increase his productivity and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to satisfy his customers

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame oumou est entrée dans le commerce il y a de cela 03ans seulement. Elle vend des habits prêt à porter et chaussures pour enfants. Elle est âgée de 34ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle a ouvert  une cantine  au marché. Avec  le crédit elle va acheter  des tissus, des body, des jeans, des chemises, des habits prêts à porter et des chaussures pour enfants. 
Oumou aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la maison et travaille pour diversifier ses produits et services. Elle a comme souhait  d’ouvrir une autre cantine pour augmenter  son bénéfice et pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants
texts.en:
Ms. Oumou started working in commerce only three years ago. She sells ready-to-wear clothing and shoes for children. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of a family. She has opened a stall at the market. With the loan, she is going to purchase some fabrics, 'body', jeans, shirts, and ready-to-wear clothing and shoes for children. 

Oumou helps her husband to cover day-to-day household expenses and works to diversify her products and services. Her wish is to open another stall to increase her profits and to be able to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, ready-to-wear clothing, and shoes for children

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda, de 35 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus padres a los que cuida en la casa que compraron hace 15 años. Todos los pobladores de su localidad la conocen, pues ella es una mujer trabajadora y admirables, por problemas en la pierna no puede caminar es así que día a día se traslada con una silla de ruedas, pero ello no es un impedimento para ella, pues como mujer triunfadora se dedica al tejido, tiene mucha creatividad, por ello posee muchos clientes entre profesores, policías, enfermeras que le solicitan constantemente los gorros, sacos, chompas, vestidos, guantes y demás prendas de vestir a base de lana que teje manualmente. Su mayor deseo es ser reconocida y tener su propia tienda. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Esmeralda, invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de lana variadas, hilos y adornos para seguir tejiendo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, who is 35, is a simple woman. She lives together with her parents, who she cares for, in the house that they bought 15 years ago. All the people in her region know her since she is a hard-working and admirable woman. Because of problems in her legs, she cannot walk and so she gets around with a wheelchair on a daily basis. But this is not an impediment to her, because as a woman who overcomes obstacles, she works doing knitting. She is very creative and has many customers, among them teachers, police and nurses, who continually request her hand-knit hats, jackets, sweaters, dresses, gloves and other garments made of wool.

Her greatest desire is to be well-known and have her own store. This is her first loan with KIVA and she is grateful for the financial help provided since it helps her to improve her business. For this reason she promises to be punctual with the payment of her instalments. Esmeralda will invest the 300 soles to purchase a variety of wools, thead and decorations in order to continue knitting.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread and decorations for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa, es una persona trabajadora y es madre soltera de tres hijos. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa, dicha actividad la aprendió de su madre, lo realiza en los horarios de 8:00am a 5:0pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de ropa femenina para damas; esta inversión le ayudara comprar diferentes prendas para ofrecerle a sus clientes y así satisfacer las necesidades de ellos.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking person, and is a single mother of three children.  She makes a living selling clothing, an activity that she learned from her mother.  She carries out her work from 8:00AM to 5:00PM.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy a variety of feminine clothing for women.  This investment will help her to buy different items for her customers and thereby satisfy their needs.

Her dream is to grow her business, and to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of feminine clothing for women.

loans.name: John Darío

texts.es: John tiene 50 años de edad y vive con su esposa en una pequeña finca que heredó de su familia. Hace más de 30 años se dedica a realizar las labores agropecuarias, pues nació y creció en el campo donde sus padres le enseñaron gran parte de lo que hoy sabe. Actualmente posee cultivos de café, los cuales cuida de Martes a Viernes y los fines de semana se dedica a atender un almacén que está ubicado en otro municipio de la región donde reside. Los ingresos que obtiene para su familia provienen de las ventas de la cosecha que recolecta y de los productos que ofrece en el almacén. El cliente es un hombre activo, pujante, trabajador y siempre busca opciones que le permitan salir adelante. Esto lo motiva para solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fungicidas, pesticidas) para seguir cuidando los cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha más productiva, con productos de mejor calidad para que sean vendidos a mejor precio en el mercado y así tener un incremento en los ingresos familiares. Es así como John desea avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es adquirir una finca más grande para ampliar sus cultivos y así seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia y disfrutar de los frutos de su ardua labor junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
John is 50 years old and lives with his wife on a small farm that he inherited from his family.  He has been engaging in farm work for more than 30 years since he was born and raised in the country.  His parents taught him most of what he knows today.  John currently has coffee crops that he looks after Tuesday through Friday.  On the weekends, he manages a store that is located in another town in the region where he resides.  The income he generates for his family comes from the sale of his harvested crops and the products that he offers in his store.  John is an active, vigorous, and hardworking man who is always looking for ways to get ahead.  For this reason he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of farming supplies (compost, fungicides, and pesticides) in order to continue maintaining his crops and to achieve a more productive harvest.  

The products he sells are of the best quality, so he is able to get the highest price at the market.  As a result, he has more family income.  John wants to continue forward with accomplishing his main goal of acquiring a larger farm so that he can expand his crops.  This will help improve his family living conditions and he will be able to enjoy the fruits of his hard labor along with his wife.

loans.use: to buy compost, fungicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely de 31 años de edad, tiene un grado académico de noveno grado, vive con su compañero de vida y con su hijo de 3 años de edad; el compañero de vida trabaja en un taller de estructuras metálicas, cuando no tiene trabajo en el taller sale a vender panes en una bicicleta. 

Ella posee un negocio de ropa,  vende en su casa a los vecinos. Además, tiene un puesto en la plaza del cantón, en el que vende pupusas, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más ropa y calzado para vender. Pretende, hacer crecer su negocio y sus ingresos para tener mejores condiciones de vida. Desea, seguir creciendo su negocio, para en un futuro mejorar su vivienda construyendo una habitación más.
texts.en:
Aracely is 31 years old and has had education up to ninth grade.  She lives with her life partner and 3-year old son. Her partner works in a workshop which makes metal structures and when he has no work in the workshop he goes out on a bicycle selling bread.

Aracely has a clothing business and sells from home to her neighbours. She also has a stall on the canton's square, where she sells "pupusas" [stuffed tortillas] and has been doing this for 3 years.

She will use the loan to buy more clothing and footwear to sell. She hopes to grow her business and her income in order to have a better standard of living. She wants to continue growing the business so that in the future she can improve her home by building an extra room.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 45 años de edad, esta acompañada, tiene 3 hijos y por la pobreza en que se crío, nunca fue a la escuela. Cuenta con 25 años de experiencia en la agricultura, ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos, todos los años siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, del cual almacena una parte para su alimentación durante todo el año y el excedente lo vende, para suplir otras necesidades. Aunque, también trabajan como jornales con otros productores, para ganarse unos $4 dólares al día, para brindar el estudio y alimentación a sus hijos. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar láminas, hierro y pagar un albañil, para hacerle una habitación a su casa, para sus hijos. Para adquirir sus materiales, viajara desde su comunidad en autobús durante 45 minutos, hasta llegar a la ciudad, ahí comprara en una ferretería. 
Su  casa es pequeña, y tiene una sola habitación, por lo que la familia vive un poco incomoda por falta de espacio, por lo que ampliándola, la familia vivirá mejor. Como los hijos, ya están adolescentes, necesitan un espacio mas privado, al menos para dormir. Con el préstamo, sus hijos podrán construir su habitación y vivirán más cómodos. 
Sueña con instalar una tienda, para tener ingresos y ayudar a sus hijos a que sigan estudiado hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 45, has a spouse and three children and because of the state of poverty she grew up in never went to school.  She has 25 years’ experience in agriculture which is her only source of income.  She plants 14,000 square meters of corn every year.  She stores part of her yield for food the rest of the year and sells what’s left over to cover other needs.  They also work as day laborers for other growers to earn about 4 dollars a day to provide food and schooling for their children.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy metal sheeting, iron rods and to pay a construction worker to add a bedroom for their children to their house.  In order to buy the materials she’ll take a 45 minute bus ride from her community to the city to buy them in a hardware store.

Her house is small and only has one bedroom so the family lives with little comfort because of the lack of space; by enlarging it the family will live better.  Since the children are adolescents already they need their own, private space at least to sleep in.  With the loan her children will be able to build their bedroom and live more comfortably.  She dreams with opening a store to earn income and help her children stay in school until they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Aliou Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou est un homme qui habite à 7km du Guichet, âgé de 58ans, il est marié et père de famille de 7 enfants dont le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 17. Il évolue dans l'embouche et a une expérience de plus de 30ans dans cet activité. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de la maison et commence sa journée à 8 pour la terminer à 19h du soir. Monsieur Aliou sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 200000F pour acheter des moutons et chèvres pour ensuite les revendre dans le marché de sa localité. A l'avenir Aliou veut ouvrir une ferme agricole pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mr. Aliou is a man who lives 7 km from the branch office. He is 58 years old, married, and a father with a family of seven children, of whom the oldest is 28 years old, and the youngest is 17. Mr. Aliou has been working at raising livestock and has over thirty years of experience in this business. He manages the day-to-day household expenses. His days begins at 8 AM and ends at 7 PM. 

Mr. Aliou is requesting this loan in the amount of 200,000 francs CFA to purchase sheep and goats to resell at the market in his town. For the future, he wants to start a farm to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to resell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 55, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, in the Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a vendor, and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Evelyn operates her family's buy and sell business.  What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell it with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy by her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise like undergarments needed in her business.

Evelyn dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have good health to continue working. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise like undergarments needed in her business.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Ana” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Choré. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, ellas son de una colonia bastante alejada, y con poco acceso a ciertos medios de comunicación, son de una zona muy rural y aun en desarrollo.
La Sra. Mariela, una de ellas, tiene una mercería con todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, artículos varios y demás, con lo que tiene los medios para poder ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
Ella quiere invertir su crédito en su negocio, ya que quiere comprar prendas y artículos varios y así seguir trabajando. Los fines de semanas ellas organizan actividades como venta de sopa paraguaya y bingo para obtener fondo y ayudarse las unas a las otras si alguna no tiene algún inconveniente.
texts.en:
The committee named “Santa Ana” was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Choré joining together.  All of the committee members have independent business activities.  They are from a remote neighborhood that has little access to certain forms of communication.  The area is very rural and still under development.  

One of the members is Sra. Mariela.  She has a variety store where she sells all types of products including clothes, various sundries, and other items.  Through her business, she has been able to improve her quality of life.  Mariela wants to invest her loan in her business.  She wants to buy clothes and various sundries so that she can continue working.  

On the weekends, the group organizes fundraising activities, such as selling Paraguayan soup and hosting bingo games.  This enables the group to help one another if any of the members encounters some difficulties.

loans.use: to buy clothes and various sundries.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilou has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Marilou is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia de 50 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y solamente estudio 9° grado. Cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, en el cuido de ganado de repasto. Pero un día, se le ocurrió buscar un injertador y realizo unos cuantos injertos de mango, al ver las buenas cosechas, empezó a injertar mas mango, zapote, aguacate y mamon. Actualmente, tiene cultivada 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, sus cosechas son tan buenas que le vende fruta a toda la comunidad y lleva a vender al mercado, a veces pasa días enteros fertilizando, podando y dando otros cuidos a su finca y cuidando sus novillos. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 4 novillos de repasto. Para adquirirlos, debe abordar un camión en su comunidad y viajar durante 45 minutos, hasta llegar al tiangue, ahí se pasa casi medio día, hasta encontrar los animales que le gustan, después de comprarlos, los sube al camión y regresa a casa. 
Engorda sus novillos durante varios meses, para luego venderlos y entre mas animales tenga, sus ventas serian mas continuas y también sus ingresos. 
Ella sueña con tener un establo, con vacas de raza lechera, para obtener ingresos diarios y contribuir al desarrollo de sus vecinos, aportándoles su leche.
texts.en:
Sonia, 50, is married with three children; she only completed 9th grade.  She has 20 years’ experience raising cattle.  One day though she came up with the idea of getting a grafter and started grafting mango trees.  Seeing the good crop yields she got she started grafting more mangoes, sapodilla, avocados and papaya.  She currently has 7,000 square meters of planted land.  Her harvests are so good that she sells the fruit to the entire community and takes it to market.  Sometimes she spends entire days fertilizing, pruning and providing other care to her grove and caring for calves.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy four calves to put to pasture.  To acquire them she must board a truck in her community and take a 45-minute ride to get to the livestock exchange where she spends about half a day until she finds the animals she likes.  Once she buys them she loads them on the truck and returns home.  She fattens them up for several months to then sell them.  The more animals she has the more continuous her sales as well as her income will be.  She dreams with owning a stable full of pedigree dairy cows to earn daily income and contribute to her neighbors’ development by providing milk for them.

loans.use: to buy four calves to raise.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina de 50 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y solamente estudio 2° grado. Posee 15 años de experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y cría de ganado de repasto, estas actividades las aprendió con su esposo, ya que por la falta de estudio, no pueden tener un empleo formal, y para subsistir con su familia tienen que trabajar todos los días en labores de limpieza, fertilización y cuido de su milpa, además tiene 1 vaca, todos los días vende leche y queso a los vecinos. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 15 sacos de fertilizantes, un galón de herbicida y otros insumos para sembrar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Para comprar los insumos para su cultivo, viajara en autobús, hasta la ciudad, el recorrido tarda 45 minutos.
Con la inversión, se evitara tantos viajes a la ciudad a comprar sus insumos por poquitos, ya que esto le ocasiona mayores gastos y perdida de tiempo. Al tener sus insumos en casa, dará un manejo adecuado a su cultivo, esto ayudara a tener una mayor producción y mayores ingresos. 
Sueña con instalar una tienda, para tener ingresos diarios y ayudar a los vecinos, supliendo las necesidades de su canasta básica.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 50 years old, married and has three children. She only studied up to Grade Two. She has 15 years of experience growing corn and raising livestock. She learned these activities along with her husband. As she had little education she couldn't get a formal job and to keep the family going she has to work every day cleaning, fertilizing and taking care of their corn. They also have one cow and they sell milk and cheese daily to their neighbors. 

Ernestina is requesting this loan to buy 15 bags of fertilizer, a gallon of herbicide and other supplies to plant 21,000 square meters of corn. To make this purchase she'll take a bus to the city which is a 45 minute ride. With this investment she'll avoid making many trips to the city to buy these supplies in small amounts, as it costs her money and takes up a lot of time. With the supplies at her house she can manage her crops well. This will give her a higher yield and increased profits. Her dream is to open a shop, to have a daily income and help the neighbors, offering them basic food goods.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of fertilizer, a gallon of herbicide and other supplies to plant 21,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay coffee pickers.

loans.name: Maria Olegaria

texts.es:
Doña María Olegaria es una señora muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante y con muchas fuerzas la cual comparte hogar junto a su esposo con quien procreó 5 hijos quienes están en edad escolar. Ella tiene 32 años de edad y aprendió a cultivar maíz y frijoles desde que se casó siendo el esposo quien le enseñara las diferentes actividades que a diario se realizan en el campo. Doña María Olegaria es muy emprendedora ya que ella diariamente ve la forma de como contribuir a la economía de su hogar por lo que ella también vende por catálogo productos de Avon eso le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos y a amortiguar los gastos en el hogar. Sus cultivos los tiene ubicados a 45 minutos de su casa de habitación a la los cuales se traslada a pie en compañía de sus hijos y su esposo.

Sus planes a futuro es poder comprar más terreno y cultivarlo de otra variedad la cual siga ayudando a economía de su hogar ya que sus ingresos dependen mucho de la agricultura. Como también forjar y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 3 cargas de urea, 3 cargas de abono 18-46-0, 5 cargas de abono 12-24-12, 4 litros de abono foliar, 6 galones de herbicidas con lo que dará mantenimiento a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol.
texts.en:
María Olegarias’s a very enterprising, strong woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She shares her home with her husband and five children who are school age.  She’s 32-years-old and learned how to grow corn and beans when she got married since her husband taught her the daily chores to be done daily in the fields.  

María Olegaria is very enterprising because she daily seeks ways to contribute to the household economy.  Because of this she also sells Avon products via catalog which helps her improve her income and absorb household expenses.  Her fields are located 45-minutes from home.  She reaches them on foot with her husband and children.

Her future plan is to be able to buy more land to plant other varieties to continue helping with her home’s economy because her income very much depends on agriculture as well as to strengthen and forge something of value to leave to her children.

Because of this she’s asking for a loan to buy three loads of 18-46-0 manure, 5 loads of 12-24-12 manure, 4 liters of leaf fertilizer and 6 gallons of herbicide to provide care for her corn and bean crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Maria Somelia

texts.es:
La  Señora María  es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  su  esposo y  sus 3 hijos en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de comida.
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carnes de pollo, res,  refrescos, arroz, frijoles, tortillas, plátanos, papas, yucas, condimentos, etc.  Para tener los productos suficientes para seguir elaborando sus productos para la venta.
Doña María con  el préstamo espera tener más producto que ofrecer para  poder cubrir la demanda  de los  clientes que  recibe ya que  esta su negocio en una  zona  muy  comercial. Y con los ingresos obtenidos espera mejorar un poco su situación económica y la de su familia.
Doña María en el futuro espera que su negocio sea  el comedor  más  grande de la  aduana. Gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo y sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Sra. María is a responsible, honest, and hardworking person.  She lives with her husband and three children in southern Honduras.  Her business involves selling food.  

Doña María is requesting a loan because she needs to buy chicken, beef, soft drinks, rice, beans, tortillas, bananas, potatoes, cassava, condiments, and other items.  By having a sufficient inventory of products, she can continue preparing the dishes that she sells.  With this loan, Doña María hopes to have enough products to satisfy the demand from her customers since her business is located in a commercial area.  

With the profit she earns, María hopes to slightly improve the financial situation for herself and her family.  In the future, she hopes that her business will become the largest diner in the duty-free zone.  Thanks to the investment she has made, she hopes that her children will become good people and that society will offer them better opportunities.  

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, soft drinks, rice, beans, tortillas, bananas, potatoes, cassava, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Reyma

texts.en:
Reyma is 52 years old and married, with five children. 

Reyma is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her flock.

Reyma has been raising ducks for 10 years now.   She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Reyma would like to save money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Dora Abelina

texts.es:
Dora de 63 años de edad, tiene un grado de estudio de segundo año de educación básica, esta acompañada, su compañero de vida no trabaja por motivos de salud. Además, de ellos viven con ellos un sobrino,  quien le ayuda a ella con la venta que realiza diariamente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de atol y poliada.  Madruga para hacer el atol y salir a vender, y hace poliada por las tardes ella se queda vendiendo cerca de su casa. También, se dedica a la venta de arreglos florales para día de muertos y a la venta de pólvora para la temporada navideña, tiene mas de 35 años de experiencia en el negocio, ya que manifiesta que fue la actividad que a realizado para sacar adelante a sus hijos.      

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de flores, oasis para los arreglos florales. Con el préstamo, pretende ampliar su margen de ganancia con respecto a lo invertido el año anterior, de las ganancias ella piensa invertir una parte de ellas para al compra de pólvora, por motivo que se acerca la temporada navideña.
La señora planifica seguir creciendo con su negocio y que en un futuro su sobrino se haga cargo del negocio.
texts.en:
63-year old Dora has studied up to second year of basic education. She is married but her husband has health problems and cannot work. A nephew lives with them and helps Dora with daily sales.

She earns her living selling atol (a cornflour-based drink) and poleada (thick milk-based drink). She makes the atol in the morning and then leaves the house to sell it. In the afternoons she makes the poleada and remains near the house to sell it. As well, Dora sells flower arrangements for the Day of the Dead, and fireworks at Christmas time. She has more than 35 years business experience, which has helped her and her family get ahead. 

Dora will use the loan money to buy flowers and oasis for the arrangements. She will try to earn more money than she did last year. She is planning to invest part of the profits in the purchase of more fireworks as Christmas is approaching. She wants to continue expanding the business so that in the future her nephew can take over.

loans.use: buy flowers and oasis for flower arrangements

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.es:
Doña María Reyna es una mujer de 38 años de edad una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura con el cual procreo 4 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores apoyan a sus padres con las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo trabajando fuertemente para que sus 2 hermanos terminen la escuela. Doña María Reyna aprendió este oficio desde que era muy pequeña siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones. Sus cultivos lo tienen ubicado en una comunidad cercana la cual está ubicada a unos 35 minutos aproximadamente de camino. Doña María Reyna tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta cuarto grado y trabaja fuertemente para educar sus 2 hijos menores para que ellos puedan estar mejor y con mayores oportunidades de esa manera ella podrá tener esperanzas para cuando ella y su esposo envejezcan tener un apoyo por parte de todos sus hijo.

Sus sueños y planes a futuro como madre es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con mejores oportunidades de empleo y con una tierra donde vivir y trabajar. Para su negocio poder sembrar una mayor cantidad y variedad de producto para de esa manera fortalecer sus tierras y fortalecer la economía en su hogar.
