Por los que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual ella pueda inyectar capital a sus cultivos protegiéndolos con los diferentes insumos que comprara como abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas entre otros que harán de la temporada una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
María Reyna, 38, is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.   She and her husband work in agriculture.  They have four children.  The two older ones help their parents with the various field chores working hard so that their two siblings can complete their schooling.

María Reyna learned this occupation when still very young since her parents taught her how to work the land since they’ve been farmers for generations.  Her crops are located in a nearby community located about 35 minutes away.  María Reyna did not complete elementary school; she only got up to fourth grade but she works hard to school her two younger children so that they can be better and with better opportunities.  In this way, she hopes that for when she and her husband are old-aged they’ll get support from all their children.

Her future dreams and plans as a mother are to see her children living under better conditions with better employment opportunities and with land to live on and to work.  For her business, they are to plant larger amounts and varieties of products to strengthen the soil and her home’s economy.  

This is why today she’s asking for a loan to inject capital into her crops protecting them with the various supplies like manure, fertilizer, fungicide, etc.,  she’ll buy that will lead to a good harvest season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Batjargal lives with his wife and daughter in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital of Mongolia. The family income consists of his taxi service income and his wife's teaching salary. 

The borrower wants to build his dream house before winter.  He has used his previous loans for buying specific building materials such as planks, cement, bricks, and fiberglass. Now he is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000 to buy vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 14 years. She sells  variety of items such as canned goods, rice, soap and other miscellaneous items. 

Argie is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Argie would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Yuami

texts.es:
Doña Vilma es una mujer de 32 años de edad una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura con el cual tiene un hijo el cual tiene 3 años de edad viviendo en casa solo ellos tres. Doña Vilma aprendió este oficio desde que era muy pequeña siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones. Sus cultivos de maíz y hortalizas están ubicados en su misma propiedad por lo que esto ayuda y permite a dar un mejor mantenimiento y asistencia para que estén sanos y libres de plagas. Doña Vilma tiene un grado de educación primaria completado el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres. Por lo que diariamente trabaja fuertemente para ahorrar y asegurar el futuro de su hijo para que el no pase por la misma situación que ella en su juventud.

Sus sueños y planes a futuro como madre es ver a su hijo en mejores condiciones de vida, con mejores oportunidades de empleo y con una tierra donde vivir y trabajar. Para su negocio poder sembrar una mayor cantidad y variedad de producto para de esa manera fortalecer sus tierras y fortalecer la economía en su hogar. Por los que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual ella pueda inyectar capital a sus cultivos protegiéndolos con los diferentes insumos que comprara como abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas entre otros que harán de la temporada una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Vilma, 32, is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to get ahead.  She and her husband work in agriculture and have a 3-year-old son; the three of them live alone in their house.  

Vilma learned her occupation when she was little since her parents taught her to work the land; they’ve been farmers for generations.  Her corn and vegetables crops are located on her same property which is a help to her and allows her to provide better care and maintenance so that they will stay free of pests and be healthy.  Vilma completed elementary school which she was able to complete thanks to the support provided by her parents.  She works hard every day to save in order to insure her son’s future so that he won’t go through the same situation she did in her youth.

Her future dreams and plans as a mother are to see her son in better conditions than hers with better employment opportunities and with land to work and to live on.   For her business, they are to be able to plant larger variety and amount of product to strengthen the soil and her family economy.

She’s asking for a loan today to inject capital into her crops protecting them with the various supplies like manure, fertilizer and fungicide, among others that will lead to a good harvest season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 58, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Juanito, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Elvira dreams that one day her store will become a grocery store and hopes to have her house renovated.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 63 years old, married, and has five children. She is from Carmen Annex. She runs a general store, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Rosita is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks to sell.  She has repaid her previous loans in a timely fashion. She hopes to open more store outlets soon.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn, a 46-year-old married mother of three, has been earning a living  raising pigs in the Philippines for 11 years. She makes additional income from farming vegetables and selling ready-to-wear clothing.


Geralyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es:
Don José de 58 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado educativo, es viudo. Conviven con una nuera y 4 nietos, los cuales están estudiando y su nuera realiza los quehaceres del hogar. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años, por su propia cuenta. Anteriormente, lo hacia con su padre de quien aprendió el oficio. Viaja un kilómetro a pie hasta donde tiene el cultivo de maíz,también cuida unos cañales que están cerca de su vivienda  .

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde va cultivar,comprara abono semilla, pesticidas para su cultivo. Para adquirir los insumos agrícolas,viajara en un bus hasta la ciudad.

 Gracias al crédito tendrá mas ingresos para su familia y poder cancelar su crédito y con las ganancias seguir construyendo su nueva vivienda,  mejorar su cultivos. Para todo esto, sabe que podrá lograrlo, solamente si continua trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old, has had no education and is a widower. He lives with a daughter-in-law and 4 grandchildren, who are studying. His daughter-in-law does the household tasks.

José has been working in agriculture for 40 years and is self-employed. Previously he worked with his father from whom he learnt his skills. He walks a kilometre to where he grows his corn and he also looks after some water channels near to his house.

The loan he is asking for is to pay the rent of the land where he goes to grow his crops and to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for his crops. He travels by bus to the city to buy his agricultural supplies.

Thanks to the loan he will have more income for his family and will be able to pay off his loan. With the profits he will be able to continue building his new home and improve his crops. He knows that he will only be able to achieve all of this if he keeps working hard, as he has done up until now.

loans.use: to pay the rent of the land where he goes to grow his crops and to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: David Lorenzo

texts.es: Durante el año pasado David sembró nuevas plantas en su terreno y pasó de tener 1600 a 2000 por cada hectárea, lo que servirá para que su producción sea mayor. Esto fué posible gracias a un crédito que obtuvo por parte de Kiva y para esta cosecha nuevamente solicita otro financiamiento el cual utilizará para comprar fertilizantes y realizar algunos trabajos de limpieza en su terreno.
texts.en: During the last year David planted new plants on his land and went from having 1,600 to 2,000 per hectare which will lead to his crop yield being larger.  This was possible thanks to a Kiva loan he got and now for the current harvest he’s once again asking for another loan that he’ll use to buy fertilizer and do some land clearing chores.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clear his land.

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Sayu Komang lives in the city of Negara in west Bali. She helps her husband provide income by running a pig business at her home. Besides being a pig breeder she also has a small kiosk.

In order to expand her business, Sayu Komang is raising capital by joining the group, Teratai Indah, where she was chosen by other members as the head of the group. They work together with MUK to get business loans for pig farmers.

With the loan of 18,000,000 IDR for the group, Sayu Komang receives 2,000,000 IDR. She is planning to buy 3 piglets with a price of 500,000 IDR each and also feed for them. Although feed is currently very expensive, she expects the sale of the 3 pigs later will gain a satisfactory profit and can increase the income of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Mr. Batjargal, 36 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a monitoring engineer at building company for two years. His wife has been decorating house interior components and works on contract with building companies or individuals. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. So, he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the upcoming winter. Also, they will burn less coal for heating and fewer pollutants will be released into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед 40 лет. Он женат и воспитывает прекрасных детей. Хуршед имеет высшее образование и работает в государственном учреждении. Хуршед старается, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование и стали высококвалифицированными специалистами. Его дочь Манзура в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса по специальности Международное Отношение. Хуршед должен оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери , но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kurshed is 40, married, and is raising wonderful children. He has a college degree and works in a government institute. Kurshed is trying to ensure that his children receive a college education and become highly qualified specialists. His daughter Manzura graduated from high school this past year and was accepted at the State University of Politics and Business with a major in International Relations. Kurshed needs to pay for his daughter's tuition, but cannot afford it. He is requesting a loan to pay for the tuition. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's college tution

loans.name: Bilguun

texts.en: Mr. Bilguun is a student who studies in the local private university. He is really passionate for science, especially medical science. This is the reason why he chose this profession. Bilguun is the only child of the family and a very hardworking student. This loan will help him to continue to study and graduate successfully.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
This is Shirley. She previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Shirley hopes that her business will get stronger and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future Julie would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 42 years old and married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fourteen years. 

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Angelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
